The Ministry of Development informs:
Beholder 2 Beta is already added to your Steam Library. Give it a try and tell us what you think!
Add Beholder 2 to your Wishlist: owners of the original game will get a Loyalty Bonus when Beholder 2 releases!
Note that Beholder 2 Beta is only available in English, Russian and Simplified Chinese.
Visit the Store Page

To find out if a tenant is home, look through his or her keyhole or knock on his or her door.
To be able to fix furniture, you need a set of repair tools. You can purchase one at the store.
Correspondence has its far side.
You can learn useful information by talking with your tenants.
To collect all relevant information, click on the security camera icons or peep through the keyhole.
If the tenant does something illegal, his or her action icon changes color.
While searching an item, click on its description to collect it. Some items don't have a description.
Your tenants will be unhappy if they find you in their apartment.
Theft is a crime. At some point, the police will prepare an ambush for you, and you'll have to extract yourself from it. The more often you steal, the greater your chances of being ambushed.
You can buy some items from a merchant. If the government issues a directive declaring an item illegal, then its value will increase.
You can blackmail your tenants, but they won't pay you forever.
You can choose how to play and what to do. Just remember: most choices have consequences.
The members of Carl's family can die if you don't fulfill their requests.
Most of the stories can be completed in a number of ways. The end of the overall story depends on the choices you make.
You can move the camera using the WASD keys or by clicking and holding the left mouse button and then moving the mouse.
The game is automatically saved after every quest.
Do not exit Beholder if you see an animated square with arrows. The game is being saved!
When a tenant does something illegal, the action icon turns red.
Your game is automatically saved upon the completion of every quest. When you exit the game, however, all unsaved progress is lost.
Use the Profile tab in your log. Click Repair to repair an apartment. Click Move in to acquire new tenants.
Personal belongings of the tenant can be appropriated with impunity after his arrest. They are kept in a box in front of the apartment. The box will disappear after the repair.
You can use the Profile tab in your log to repair an apartment and then rent it out.
Bill
Address: Krushvice, 6
To: Carl Stein
Amount due:

Healthcare
Utilities

Caviar for Gen. Airel Johnson
Drinks for Gen. Airel Johnson

Tenant's complaint about you.
Agent Mark Ranek has reported the bribery of an official.
For the funeral services.
Carl Stein, we inform you that your son, Patrick Stein, was dismissed due to non-payment of the study fee. He has therefore been sent to mine 37/42 as a utility worker. Ministry of Distribution
Citizen Mark Ranek reported the bribery of an official. You tried to gain illegal access to the archive papers on Klaus Schimmer. You are issued a warning and a fine.
Penalty for having an anti-government poster in the building.
Pay the Ministry of Allocation fee.
For the funeral services (Anna Stein's funeral)
For the funeral services (Patrick Stein's funeral)
For the funeral services (Martha Stein's funeral)
For Anna Stein's healthcare. Treating injuries inflicted during riot.

Collecting info
It is illegal to possess explosives or engage in activism!
It is illegal to own or wear red socks or to recite poems by Carl Vust!
It is illegal to possess and use weapons!
It is illegal to talk on a phone or own a handbook.

Long live the Common Council, which is celebrating the twentieth anniversary of its reign. Festivities of all kinds have begun. Creative programs, theater performances, films, exhibitions focused on the great accomplishments of the State, and more are waiting for you. Bless our mighty and benevolent Government!
It is illegal to cry, or for more than three people to assemble outside of the main square!
Due to the destabilization of the western front, all citizens are permitted to carry weapons! Also, remember to be solemn at all times, for that is the norm of life
It is illegal to store or consume alcohol!
All apples must be destroyed. It is illegal to store or consume them.
All forms of entertainment are prohibited!
Being sick and hiding is prohibited! It is also illegal to own medical supplies.
It is illegal to read or own a book!
It is illegal to own a rubber duck!
The production of drugs is prohibited!
It is illegal to read or own a book by Paul Williams.
The production of political propaganda is prohibited.
Singing in front of the Ministry of Order is prohibited.
Complaining about the Ministry of Transportation is prohibited.
It is illegal to use foreign currency.
It is illegal to own or wear old clothes.
It is illegal to harbor criminals or hide their actions.
Sing in front of the Ministry of Order
The State has banned old books! All books older than 30 years must be destroyed!
It is illegal to manufacture drugs!
It is illegal to wear or sell jeans!
It is illegal to possess foreign music!
It is illegal to criticize the Wise Leader!
It is illegal to possess fish!
It is illegal to make guns!
It is illegal to store light bulbs!
It is illegal to converse!
It is illegal to wear a blue tie!
It is illegal to drink alcohol!
It is illegal to patronize a bar!
It is illegal to possess foreign salt!
It is illegal to destroy propaganda!
Consumption of chocolate and coffee is prohibited.
Imported salt is prohibited.
War talk is prohibited.
War talk
Criticizing the Wise Leader is prohibited.
Imported soda is prohibited.
Skating is prohibited.
Playing the violin is prohibited.
Spoiling of agitational posters is prohibited!
Keeping and usage of foreign medicines is prohibited!
Smoke detector
Spot for a poster
Phone
Door
Mailbox
Chair
Armchair
Bed
Child's bed
Wardrobe
Bookcase
Bookshelf
Table
Wicker chair
A very comfortable wicker chair. I should buy one when I retire. I should also buy wool slippers and a pipe!
Chess table
A special chess table. Only a real aficionado would have one.
Easel
Old and squeaky but functional.
Piano
Old but still plays well.
Nightstand
Desk
Fish bowl
Not bad for a goldfish. A little seaweed would make it feel like home.
Flowering shrub
Those pink blossoms smell wonderful.
Potted plant
My wife says the leaves look like fishtails, but I think they resemble sharp tongues.
Potted plant
Some sort of a fern.
Beautiful painting
A quality reproduction of the famous masterpiece, Windy Day," by Slavko Hugo.
Phone
TV
Dream radio

Works better on the upper floors; the basement is out of the question. Receives only two State channels, but some people have used amplifiers to receive international channels, too. That's a good way to end up in prison.
Record player
Record players produce the best sound! The audio feels real and alive and warm! Unlike the soulless modern music players, the record player was once the centerpiece of the home.
Heater
A must-have appliance in our cold, wet climate.
Typewriter
It's old but it works. Although one could pen a masterpiece with a quill, a typewriter would make writing easier.
Washing machine
Surveillance camera
Narrow viewing range
Narrow viewing range. Videotaping available.
Moderate viewing range
Moderate viewing range. Videotaping available.
Wide viewing range
Wide viewing range. Videotaping available.
Repair kit
Furniture repair kit.
Appliance repair kit.
Anti-state banner
Jeans
Every teenager's dream. Some want to wear them; some want to burn them.
Electrician's kit
Cabinetmaker's kit
Leaflet
Compass
A large compass for design work.
Blueprints
Blueprints of technical devices, communications equipment, and rockets.
Stethoscope
An essential tool for any medical worker.
Lab coat
Medical worker uniform
Bandage
Arm bandage with a red cross.
Access card to the court
All state objects of vital importance require special access cards.
Hard hat
A miner's hat with a personal ID number on one side.
Mittens
Mittens made of sackcloth.
Wrench
Nothing special; just a key.
Engine oil
A large jar of engine oil.
Light bulb
Its low capacity provides dim and gloomy light.
Screwdriver
It's just a screwdriver. I hope no one inserts it into an inappropriate place.
Insulating tape
This is industrial insulating tape. It's used in factories and not sold in stores.
Service cap
This cap has no logos or emblems identifying it with a specific organization, so anyone can wear it.
Striped vest
Even movers wear striped vests in the port.
Factory access card
Following a series of explosions, factories and plants were declared restricted facilities. An access card is required for entry.
Thread
A large spool of thread.
Thimble and needle
A simple sewing kit.
Manuscripts
A pile of handwritten notes. The handwriting is messy.
Passport
Every citizen must have a passport.
This isn't a fake passport; it's the real thing.
Toothbrush
An ordinary toothbrush. I have one just like it. You can't find the other kind in stores.
Towel
Good towels are hard to come by.
Comb
It's just a comb. And an old one at that.
Razor
An open razor. Keep it in its carrying case.
Notebook
Names, dates, other info... Nothing of interest.
Watch
The strap is worn but made of quality leather.
Pocket watch
A quality pocket watch. Judging by its condition, it's at least 50 years old!
Eyeglasses
The frames are cheap and have been repaired several times.
Scissors
A dull pair of scissors.
Letter
This envelope contains a letter.
Diary
A tenant's personal diary
Wallet
An unremarkable wallet containing very little money.
Phonebook
Contains the phone number of every citizen and business.
Blue shirt
A plain, cotton shirt of medium quality. It's very popular with citizens.
Purple shirt
A plain, cotton shirt of medium quality. It's very popular with citizens.
Green tie
A brightly colored tie. Suitable only for festive occasions.
Blue tie
A classic tie designed for every occasion.
Belt
A thick leather belt.
Sweater
This sweater is produced at knitting factory no. 16. It's available in four colors, but this one is the best.
Old sweater
A slightly worn sweater. It clearly served its owner for more than a year, but he didn't take care of it.
Boots
Durable all-weather boots.
Old shoes
These shoes have been repaired many times... But won't be again...
Robe
A luxurious bath robe.
Trousers
Classic trousers suitable for either a wedding or a funeral.
Pants
A few years ago, the hero in a popular movie wore these pants. A month later, everyone in the country had a pair.
Sock
Just a sock. An ordinary sock. Not even an extraordinary sock.
Red sock
Just a red sock. An ordinary red sock. It doesn't even have ankle stripes. It's just red, through and through.
Blue sock
Empty envelope
An empty envelope with no writing on the outside.
Parts
Different metal parts.
Unfinished device
This looks like part of a bomb.
Violin
Antique violin
A rare and expensive instrument. Judging by its condition, it's in good hands.
Dumbbells
Heavy and solid.
Dumbbells do not lie idle.
Stamp album
For collecting stamps.
Rare and expensive stamps. Very valuable!
Coin collecting album
A leather album filled with coins.
Rare antique and modern coins from a variety of countries.
Tennis kit
For advanced players only.
There are two tennis courts in the city. You'll see a long line near both.
Bow and arrows
Used archery kit.
Judging by its condition, it's well used.
Ball of yarn
Quality wool thread and knitting needles.
Since shops contain few products, knitting has become a very profitable business.
Camera
A professional-grade camera. Takes excellent color shots.
Belongs to an amateur photographer.
Film
An unused reel of film.
Photography is an expensive but unique hobby.
Fishing rod
You can catch the mightiest fish with this quality rod.
Its owner is an avid angler.
Ice skates
Blades for figure skating. These are the only ones stores sell.
There's only one ice rink in the city, so skating is far from popular.
Ship model
A prefabricated ship model.
Some parts are not yet painted or glued.
Star atlas
A magazine for the astronomical community.
Contains diagrams showing the location of galaxies, position data, and complex calculations.
World map
An illustrated and detailed map of the world.
Contains marks on almost every page. Airports and major roads are highlighted.
Deck of cards and dice
Used cards and dice.
These cards are used in games in which the participants gamble money.
Gardening magazine
Advice for growing potted plants and garden flowers.
The pack also includes seeds, a planting calendar, and detailed descriptions of local soils.
Violin concerto
A collection of works for the violin.
Used sheet music with marks on the pages.
Coffee beans
Fresh and fragrant coffee beans.
Grain coffee is for foodies. The rest are satisfied with wish-wash from cans.
Turkish coffee pot
Copper coffee pot for making coffee.
Grain coffee is for foodies. The rest are satisfied with wish-wash from cans.
Paints
A palette with a variety of paints.
Its owner is an artist. He used these paints recently.
Reproductions
Several posters of famous paintings.
Such posters are sold only at the Ministry of Arts, and are very expensive.
Chess
Chess pieces made of onyx.
It looks like someone got a lot of use out of this chess set.
Tobacco
A pouch full of mediocre tobacco.
This pipe is well used. I hope they smoke tobacco, not something nasty...
Mediocre tobacco.
Likes to gamble.
Paintbrush
A multipurpose brush.
One can use this brush for any kind of painting.
Sheet music
A collection of piano classics.
The flurry of notes suggest these are challenging pieces to play.
Purple blouse
A new silk blouse. Some of the threads aren't cut!
A tag with the customer's name and the price is pinned to the blouse.
Cook book
A recipe book containing delicious dishes from around the world.
"Elaborate Recipes for a Top-Notch Chef"
Soccer ball
This ball has been kicked around quite a bit. Good thing it was well made.
This ball has found the net many times.
Theatre mask
This is probably a cheap theatrical prop, although it could be valuable...
This kind of mask is a calling card for amateur theaters.
Spyglass
Lens diameter: 80 mm
Judging by the markings and the type of lens, this is a professional-grade spyglass.
Foreign money
A stack of shiny coins. Whose profile is that?
Coins
Stores foreign coins
Red dress
It's embarrassing to search others' belongings, but it's my job!
Blue dress
Every woman has a dress like this.
Sweater
Warm, hand-knitted sweater.
Green jacket
An ordinary woven jacket.
Blue blouse
A simple cotton blouse.
Shoes
Common domestic shoes
Cardigan
Perfect for cool weather.
Brooch
Gold-plated brooch with a large blue stone.
Blue skirt
Judging by the material, it was sewn at the local factory.
Slouch hat
A weekend hat. Slightly worn but treated with care.
Straw hat
Such hats are rarely worn these days, as the smog is hard on them.
Handbag
Quality leather handbag.
Bomb
A dangerous explosive device.
BOMB found!
Pistol
A real gun. Does the owner have permission to possess it?
It's illegal to own a weapon!
Empty bottles
Dirty empty bottles
The person who lives here is a slob! Would it be so hard to throw away all of this junk?
Broken bottle
A broken bottle with jagged edges.
With a little skill, a broken bottle can be turned into a dangerous weapon.
Book
A sappy, sentimental love novel. Barf!
The book has been read many times. I found a dried flower between its pages.
Molotov cocktail
A full bottle. One could use it to bomb something.
One could use it to bomb something.
Foreign letter
A letter with a foreign stamp.
The tenant is corresponding with someone who lives abroad.
Manuscript
Sheets of paper with handwriting on them. This appears to be a work of fiction.
The margins contain a lot notes. This must be a rough draft.
Narcotic
A bottle of sleeping pills.
This is a strong narcotic. It's available by prescription only.
Hiding information about crimes
Proof of guilt
This isn't Sarah Wattermach!
Criminal!
Chocolate candy
Most candy is sold in powdered sugar form, which makes it stick together. This one has bright wrapping.
Chocolate bar
A treat for children and adults.
Colored pencils
One day, our pencils will be yellow and bright again. These pencils look like they're made of dirt, but it's not like kids have a choice.
Ball
A bouncy and resilient rubber ball.
Wooden blocks
One can use these to make words and castles. Citizens are allowed to own only two sets, so these would be very short words and very small castles.
Duck
Our daughter loves ducks. One day, we'll have our own bathroom, and we'll let that duck swim in a bubble bath.
Old doll
My wife played with this doll as a child. Now our daughter does. She calls it Naira, even though that name is more suitable for a cat.
Stacking toy
My coworkers gave me this when Patrick was born. I had to sand it off, though, because the wooden rings had a bunch of splinters.
Book
"Patriotic Tales for Kids"
Teddy bear
This must be imported. We don't make beautiful things like this.
Pretty doll
We don't have these in our stores. All we have are wooden and rubber toys.
Teddy bear
Cute teddy bear
Book
Books
A famous novel. Judging by the cover, it's just more propaganda...
A well-worn book.
A pile of rare books. Novels by authors of the last century.
Modern dictionary
Stories by Carl Woost. He wrote humorous tales about our country, and was executed for doing so.
"The Great Life of our Beloved Leader." A book about the inspiring life of our Great Leader.
Log
The landlord's log. It contains all of the necessary info.
Rare and valuable books on economics. These are just what Patrick needs for his studies!
An illustrated anatomy atlas.
Paul Williams' philosophical books. I read his manifest on free societies as a student. It sounded like a fairy tale.
It's illegal to own these books!
Laws, amendments, and addendums. Dull legal literature.
First AID
A standard first aid kit containing everything you need to render emergency care.
Aspirin
A bottle of pills. The label says it's aspirin.
Medicine
An effective medicine against child and adult anemia.
Glasses
These belong to Mark Ranek, an honored employee of the archive.
Letter
A letter from my wife, which I received a couple of days ago. She says our son misses the Joneses. They are waiting for their family to join them.
I found my wife's letter to me.
Absentee certificate
Issued to Klaus Schimmer. These allow you to move around the country. It's illegal to leave the city without one.
Cruise tickets
Two ocean liner tickets to the Southern shore.
Strawberry soap
Fragrant strawberry soap. I heard it's manufactured here, but I've never seen any in stores. All we have are the stinky tar and lye soaps.
Regular socks.
Pot
A garden variety pot.
Rat poison
Potent rat poison. It's dangerous! Wear protective gear when using.
Golden brooch
A family treasure.
Money
An envelope of money for canned goods
Still
A set of retorts for experiments
The tenant is acting suspiciously!
Veil
Wearing a fancy dress and a tuxedo to your wedding is considered archaic, but some romantic brides still wear a veil. Usually, it's made of curtains.
Sagebrush
A smelly weed that grows in the wastelands. It's said to be effective against bedbugs and unwelcome guests.
Flower
A pretty plant with a delicate aroma.
Flowers are expensive, so few people can afford them. They're grown in special greenhouses.
Arsenic
A full bottle. Many undesirable people have fallen victim to that fragrant potion.
Medal
It's a medal for performing an act of bravery at the Battle of Aglow.
It's shiny! It must be expensive.
Note
It says Grubic is going to come to talk with me. He's going to meet me at Big Brother Bar. My forms are printed on the same paper.
Explosive device
This bomb consists of a timer, six closed circuits, and six sticks of dynamite.
Knife
A very sharp knife!
Handmade gun
Is it a toy or a real gun?
Newspaper
This isn't yesterday's news, it's last year's news!
Record
Patriotic songs.
Foreign music.
Dance music.
Tiger balm
This balm is excellent for stopping a runny nose, but it'll make you cry. So after your sinuses are clear, you have to cure your eyes!
Roll of fabric
Durable fabric for making propaganda banners. Trade unions give it out before meetings. Some folks try to be creative, but the government strictly monitors its use.
The tag says, "Issued to Patrick Stein."
Box
I need to give this to Fulfledle Brukich.
Poster piece
"Need a vacation? Then escape to luxurious..." I'd say this is an ad rather than propaganda.
Liebespirit
Foreign medicine for Martha.
Gift
This is for Airel Johnson.
Top secret blueprints
These are blueprints of nuclear weapons!
Passport
A fake passport.
A passport with personal data but no photo.
A passport with no info and a place for a photo.
Antibiotics
Can sure many illnesses.
Fee for silence
Nippers
A very useful tool. To cut a cable or... Well, it is enough.
Meat pie
It smells wonderful but I'm not sure about the filling... I hope I don't know the owner of that bone...
Illegal object found!
Very black and very strong.
Black tea
Bag of candy
Colorful lollipops that stick together when it's hot outside. It's the most popular candy available.
Canned fish
50 cans of questionable fish...
A ripe, juicy apple
Green apple
Red apple
Rum
Thunderation! Rum is hard to come by these days!
Whiskey
Your best friend in cold weather.
Wine
Red wine in a bottle.
Expensive and well-aged wine. It's not available in the State shops.
Soda
Foreign. Contents unknown.
Soda
Local. It's a blast from the past!
Fish
So dry I can't take a single bite.
Salt
Foreign salt. The granules are very fine. Domestic salt is so rough it breaks your teeth.
Voice of Truth
Theatre scandal

The first evening performance of the capital play "On Love and Peace" resulted in a scandal. Part of the audience left before the end. "Plays should portray real people, not silly stories that have nothing to do with reality," said Bruno Raus, head of plant No. 1's recreation department. The theatre administration promised to shut down the play and ensure future plays don't upset the workers.

Once every three years, great actors come to our nowheresville and receive a cold welcome! "On Love and Peace," the latest play to premiere at our local theatre, was shut down when raging miners refused to watch the love story. It's hard to blame them. There's no place for feelings in the life of a common laborer; just work, quarrels, and grocery store lines. But comrades! Let's not allow our slavery to take away our aesthetic sensitivity! Go to the theatre!
Who will work, then? The country needs our labor, not shows!
Dead Words

The Ministry of Truth has noticed a rising interest in philosophy books, including the works of Paul Williams, who died a century ago. His writings describe obsolete ideas that have been proven to be unrealistic; however, they still capture people's minds. The Ministry believes the notion of a society without government, in which the freedom of personal choice exists, is dangerous and should be destroyed in all its forms.

The fact that our society is capable of understanding Paul Williams' ideas en mass proves his unique talent and ability to word things simply. We should encourage interest in the great thinkers of the past if we want to progress and initiate a dialogue between the people and the State.
Philosophy is nonsense.
Death by Needle

The son of the miners' trade union leader was found unconscious after criminals reportedly pumped him full of drugs. He's being treated and rehabilitated at the hospital. The Ministry of Order advises citizens to be alert and interfere with any attempts to manufacture and spread drugs. Remember: your child could be next!

Drugs are a huge problem in our society. We should've started dealing with them a long time ago, not wait for a VIP to get in trouble. By the way, this isn't the first time the well-known son has been at the center of a scandal. Was he really a victim?
The Right Path

We are aware of the complaints our citizens are making about the public transportation system. The deputy head of the Ministry of Transportation said, "Public transportation is one of the most important factors impacting the efficiency of our labor. And the performance of every Ministry employee is satisfactory." He also said senseless and groundless complaints waste valuable time that could be spent working, and will be considered sabotage in the future.

It's widely known that the state department is swarming with officials, and that the bureaucracy has become so cumbersome, it can't function. Besides, the city buses are dozens of years old, and the drivers haven't been given a raise in all that time. It's impossible to go anywhere quickly when riding an ancient rig driven by a starving old man.
Poor guys! I should give them one of the grandma's pies tomorrow.
Water Tragedy

A tragic incident took place yesterday near Port Shier. The Goliath, which was carrying a load of coal for export, was set on fire and sank. By the time the Coast Guard found the barge, there was no one left to save. Those who escaped the flames must have drowned or been attacked by sharks. Allegedly, the vessel was also carrying 10-15 unregistered passengers. An investigation is being carried out, and a vacancy for a barge has opened on that route.

Our condolences to those who lost family members in the barge accident. It's unfortunate our fleet is in such terrible condition and isn't safe to use. It's even sadder that, despite this, people are still trying to escape the country due to the deteriorating quality of life. We advise you to not fall victim to the scammers promising paradise abroad; more often than not, our well-being is the last thing that matters to them. This can lead to tragedy.
Law Enforcement

Yesterday was marked with a small but important triumph of justice. Police arrested Klaus Schimmer as he tried to sneak into temporary confinement, where his wife was being held. Mrs. Schimmer was detained on the suspicion of violating state directives. He was shot as a threat to civil safety and a traitor. Let this serve as an example to everyone: the police safeguard our great State, and anyone threatening them will be exterminated.

Yet another case of police brutality took place yesterday. Comrade Schimmer was shot without due process outside a police station, where he'd come to inquire about his wife's condition after being denied contact with her following her arrest. The police are no longer law enforcement intended to protect us; they are a tool for threatening the people. Their new role has backfired on them, though, because they've lost the trust and respect of the people, which has resulted in increased criminal activity. Of course, the State doesn't care; even someone who's simply concerned about his or her spouse is a criminal in the eyes of our leaders.
He shouldn't have attacked the police! Was he stupid?
Food Poisoning

An unfortunate gastronomical incident took place yesterday in coal mine no. 29. Following lunch at the local dining hall, an entire shift of workers came down with food poisoning. The exact reason is unknown, although all of them ate the fish soup. Investigators have established that Rosa Ranek, the cook, was in charge of preparing and serving the soup, and they are questioning her. We should also note the iron will of the workers, who, despite great pains and a terrible fever, returned to work, realizing how much the State needs them in this time of war.

State officials are once again trying to turn someone into a scapegoat for something that's their fault! The cook simply couldn't make soup that would poison people; it's more rational to suggest the products were rotten to begin with, and were probably bought that way because they were cheaper. Worst of all, the sick miners had return to work, not out of loyalty, but out of fear of being fired!
Cooks should eat what they make to avoid things like that!
One Nation, One Language

The Ministry of Care would like everyone to use the national language. We are one nation, and should speak one language," the Minister said. Ministry officials say these measures will increase public safety, making our country less vulnerable to spies and turncoats. The latter include everyone who stores foreign literature and speaks a foreign language.

Overcome by another fit of paranoia, the Ministry of Order now considers every foreigner and foreign culture enthusiast a spy, including those who are here legally. With such an approach, all we'll be good for is selling coal! How can we deal with neighboring countries if we can't talk with them?
Why shouldn't we require them to speak our language?
Duck Invasion

An outrage occurred last night at the city port! Two unknown individuals unloaded several truckloads of rubber ducks into the water near the port. Witnesses say the trucks were marked Duck Fleet." The ducklings, which drifted for miles on the current, bore inscriptions such as "Make ducks, not mines," "Ducks want peace," and "This war is a lame duck." The Minister of Order said this was a planned attack aimed at lowering the morale of our military; therefore, those responsible will be found and prosecuted. He also said rubber ducks are now considered anti-state propaganda, and storing them will be grounds for a fine.
The editorial staff says the article was an attempt to kill the editor-in-chief, who nearly died laughing, and refuses to comment on the rubber duck ban.
Ducks are serious business!
Young, pretty, socially active girl would like to meet a well-to-do man for a serious relationship. Call 237-451.
Call! You'll be glad you did!
Don't pray; just follow the instructions! God hasn't defused a single bomb!
Manual
To defuse an explosive device, cut the colored wires in the following order:
Type MGB-53
Type NKVD-41
Type GUGB-43
ELECTION
We've made the choice for you. Just bring this piece of paper to the election headquarters.
Elections suck! This scrap of paper is as valuable as a sheet of used toilet paper!
Hello, everyone. All is well. Thank you for your help! Please come soon. It's much better here than there. Your P.
Tell Martha oranges do exist, and the only thing they have in common with carrots is their color!
I'm here! The tickets were a great idea! This place is a paradise. I even ate a pineapple! Move here; I'll help you! Your miner-gone-awry.
There are no lines here, father!
I'm writing from the beach. I got a job at a bookstore! Andrea dumped me for some smarty-pants, but I don't care. Come here.
Say hi to mom and Martha! Alas, I can't send a package to your country.

I was wrong, father! This country is worse than ours! Every morning, they make me exercise while listening to the national anthem and kiss the North Borean leader's portrait! All the restrooms are public, and all of the workers live in barracks! Our country is a paradise compared to North Borea! I was better off at the mine!
Father, take me back!

This is Dora Noel. It's better to be in jail than with my husband! I'm happy, and will never forget how you helped me. I asked for my heirloom to be transferred to your name before my accounts were suspended. You are a good man, Carl.
Don't beat your wife!

Carl, you have incredible foresight! I thought investing all of my money in apples was mad, but it made me rich! I've already received my first returns and want to thank you. I've also built a modern restroom with a color TV and a shower stall with hot water at the factory! With thanks, Leo Gvizdek.

Investing in Horns and Hoofs was a terrible idea! The business failed and I lost all money, although I now have two tons of jellied meat. I tried to sell it and was fired for trading. You are guilty of ruining my life, Carl! I wish I could make you eat all of that jellied meat! Leo Gvizdek
Breaking news!

Several hours ago, a series of explosions took place at the convenience goods storage facility on Krushvice Street. No one was killed but 15 people were injured. The situation is under control, so there's no reason to panic. Now for the weather: Tomorrow, look for winds from the north, a high of 60 degrees, and light showers.

Comrades! We have spoken - and spoken loud! The whole city heard! The explosions took place at the plant where State officials were planning to introduce 14-hour shifts! The government won't listen to our peaceful voices, so let it hear our cries of war! We will force them to respect the rights of workers! If they continue with their plans, we'll turn the Ministry to rubble!
Police on Guard

Last night, criminals boldly robbed the west branch of the Central Bank. The police neutralized them before they escaped and are working to establish their identities. Several factory workers and an underage miner are reportedly among them.

Comrades! The government has turned our workers into criminals! Poverty ruins young lives, then they die on the steps of the Central Bank with bullets in their chests! They died so we could keep fighting!
We should've recruited them! Being idle drove them crazy!
Air-tight Frontier

Accused of treason, Professor Gorchik tried to leave the country. But he and his family were arrested at the border and his children were sent to the labor camps. His attempt to escape is proof of his guilt. Bruno Hemph said, "Our main duty is to weed out our internal enemy, which is far more dangerous than our external one."

Today is a day of grief. Professor Gorchik was first defamed and then executed along with his wife and oldest daughter! Gorchik, Jr., who just turned nine, was sent to the labor camp! Let's honor their memory with a minute of silence.
Executed? Good riddance.
Incidents

The crime rate in the city continues to decline! The following was reported in Helmer during the last 24 hours: no assaults; no robberies; and only one street fight with a deadly weapon. One of our youth, Patrick Stein, was killed in that incident. The police are looking for the assailants.
If there are no criminals, who's occupying our jails? We'll tell you – anyone who opposes the government! We demand that the prison gates be opened and the innocent be set free! Freedom for all!
This is crazy! What else do you want? For the dead to be resurrected?
Violation of Order

Several unidentified individuals dressed in white robes snuck into the university and threatened to cover the blackboard with words that would tarnish the dignity of Miroslav Pepper. Prof. Pepper resigned and was rushed to the hospital. Eleven people were reportedly killed during the arrests.

Professor Pepper, who is infamous for committing bribery and other dirty deeds, has finally done something useful. Namely, he admitted to impeding the education of our young people instead of promoting it! Shame on the person that sends our students to war!
What were the doctors doing in the university?
Voice of the State

Starting today, the streets of Helmer are decorated with mobile propaganda units. Each one will be transmitting patriotic stations non-stop! Citizens will now be able to listen to the last news around the clock and resist the propaganda of the enemy!
Any normal person wants to relax quietly with a book, a TV show, or family after work! But the non-stop propaganda is torture!
University Closed

Due to the recent events at the university, the Ministry of Order has closed the facility. All of employees have been laid off, some of the students will be assigned to the labor camps, and others will be sent to war.
Comrades, we mourn that horrific decision!
There you go, idiots! Since you didn't want to study, you get to march!
Rest for Workers

The employees of mine 17 held a meeting about improving the conditions of their work environment. They decided everything is fine and signed up for a vacation. Local resorts offer a wide range of vacation and educational programs, including museum tours, visiting memorials to our Dear Leader, and attending patriotic seminars.
Being on vacation is worse than working! The workers were there to rally for improved conditions in the mines!
Mine on Fire

The employees of mine 17 are on strike. Officials have closed the mine and fired the workers. Those injured during the demonstrations were rushed to Hospital PTDC 4. In cultural news, on Dec. 21, every House of Culture will hold a celebratory concert dedicated to our Dear Leader's birthday. The ministry is currently accepting applications for amateur performances.
A mine burned down, hundreds were injured, and all they care about is the DL's birthday! We see through them! They're afraid to tell us the real news!
Poor miners. A toast to the DL on the 21st!
A War Hero Dies

Gen. Airel Johnson, a famous war hero, has tragically died! The entire country is taking part in three days of mourning! The general was shot at the Central Stadium while giving schoolkids a lecture about the importance of the army. The general is dead, but his work goes on!
Aglow Butcher kicks the bucket! Hooray! No more sending our youth to the frontline instead of school!
Life is Great

Leo Gvizdek is the winner of the Annual Labor Lottery! He has faithfully served his country for 20 years without a single violation! He is the pride of the state! The prize this year is $100,000! Remember: every citizen with more than 15 years of work experience can take part in the lottery.

People with more than 15 years of work experience can take part in the lottery. What does that tell us? That Leo and his companions in misfortune spent decades working hard and paying crazy amounts of money to the labor lottery fund. Each of them could've saved $40,000 over the course of 20 years! Where did the rest of that money go? Can the lottery administration tell us that?
Neighbor News

Our neighbor, North Borea, is celebrating today! They have exceeded their general production plan by 40 percent! Congratulations, comrades! You are leading by example! The Ministry of Development reports our country is ahead of our plan, too, as wheat was harvested a full month before it was due!

Why don't you also tell us that every third person in North Borea is working in a labor camp? And that their money has long been replaced by tallies? And that 250 people were executed for not bowing when their leader mounted the platform! It's pure slavery!
Gardens for Work!

The internal investigation of the case of the Ministry gardens is over. We are happy to report that every garden belongs to the Ministry of Households, and is not private property. The gardens are being used exclusively for state affairs and agricultural activities.
Everyone knows what they're doing! Who doubted that this would be the result of their fake "investigation?"
Incidents

The crime rate in the city continues to decline! The following was reported in Helmer during the last 24 hours: no assaults; no thefts; and just one domestic homicide. The victim was Dora Noel. The main suspect is her husband, Bruno Noel.
If there are no criminals, who's occupying our jails? We'll tell you – anyone who opposes the government! We demand that the prison gates be opened and the innocent be set free! Freedom for all!
This is crazy! What else do you want? For the dead to be resurrected?

Gen. Airel Johnson, a famous war hero, has tragically died! The entire country is taking part in three days of mourning! The general accidentally ingested poison instead of his medication. He might be dead, but his work goes on!

General Airel Johnson, a famous war hero, has tragically died! The entire country is taking part in three days of mourning! The general was stabbed to death near his residence as he was preparing to give a series of lectures in our city. He might be dead, but his work goes on!
To Arms!

Gen. Airel Johnson's lecture at the Central Stadium was a huge success! The famous war hero told a huge gathering of schoolkids about the importance of a patriotic upbringing and volunteering for the army! Over 3,000 young patriots answered his call!
Fatal prize

A lottery win has turned into a tragic loss! A fair citizen, Leo Gvizdek, won the prize and was taking the money to a bank when ne'er do wells emerged from a dark alley, attacked and killed comrade Gvizdek, and stole the money. An investigation is underway. Eyewitnesses say they heard the assailants screaming something about jellied meat.

Poor worker... Comrades, nothing good can come from the government! In a poor country, only the criminals are prospering! And honest people like us are afraid to let their children leave the house! We demand that every dark alley be brightly lit so the criminal element can't hide in the shadows!
The butcher from Agloe continues his dark work! His beautiful speeches hide a terrible call to send students to war! Why does no one hear the truth?
After the show, the group of unknown persons tried to organize a disturbance, but our valiant police force brought a quick end to their efforts.
Code 4087. This subject is under state protection.
Code 1689. Children under the age of 14 are under their parents' patronage.
Code 732. High ranking military officers are beyond your scope of responsibility.

Some items contain info about their owners. Click on <color=#9B0000FF>the highlighted text</color> to gather the information. It will be stored in the owner's file. You earn reputation points for the info you gather.

To begin writing a report, click on the desk and then choose an icon.
Choose an icon and then fill in the blanks. Send reports to the Ministry of Order.
Click on an object once to open its description.

You can watch your tenants on the streets and in the corridors, but their apartments and public halls are hidden from you. Set up surveillance equipment to see what they do in those places and listen to their conversations.
Click on the TAKE button to grab the object. Warning! Taking a person's belongings from his or her apartment is a crime. The police might set up an ambush and arrest you!
Click on the item to see a description of it. Click on the TAKE button to grab the object.
When a tenant does something illegal in view of the camera, the action icon changes color. Click on the icon to add the evidence to the dossier.
When a tenant does something the State has banned in view of the camera, the action icon changes color. Click on the icon to add the evidence to the dossier.
This is the chief. "!" means a character is ready to give you a task. Click on <icon name="action"/> to begin a conversation and then navigate through it.
You can search pieces of furniture. To try this, go to the table, click on <icon name="action"/> and select the magnifying glass icon.
Click on the item to see its description. Click on <icon name="action"/> to move it to your inventory. Click on <icon name="close"/> to close the window.
Go to the alarm and press <icon name="action"/>. Select the camera you want to install. To remove the camera, click on the box.

Click on <icon name="right_button"/> and use the right stick to zoom into the house.
Click on <icon name="left_button"/> to see which floor you're on. In the menu that opens, use the left stick to move to another floor.
If there are several interactive objects near a character, use the D-Pad <icon name="d_pad"/> to switch between them.
Select the item to see its description.
Several items in the description contain information about the people who possess them. Click on <icon name="info"/>to gather information for their profiles and earn reputation points.

When the tenant is doing something unique, the action icon turns red if the action is disabled and green when it opens information about tenants. Click on the right stick <icon name="right_stik"/> to fix this in the tenant profile.
To start writing the report, go to the table, click on <icon name="action"/> and select the journal icon.
Select the icon and click on <icon name="action"/>. Fill in the fields in the document.
Open the Tenants tab in the Workbook, select the photo of the tenant you need and click on <icon name="action"/> to open the profile.
Select the evidence and then click on <icon name="action"/> to move it to the report field. If the report is correct, the evidence will be spent.
Ensure that each field is filled in correctly and then click <icon name="info"/> to submit the report. Be careful: you'll be fined for mistakes.

But if I catch you doing this again, you'll be punished!
Bad news: someone is going to end up behind bars today.

Your job is to solve problems, not create them!
What are you doing in someone else's apartment? Are you stealing something?

Talk with you later.

Get to work!
I understand.

Stay calm and repair anything in the house that's broken.

Begin your next task.
Attach the evidence you gather to your report.
Watch him. Use your cameras. He might do something illegal in view of one of them.

Your tenants keep sending us complaints.

I understand.
I agree to meet your doctor. Give him my number and the secret word...

I'll be waiting for his call.
Did you write it down?
Hello, Carl?
Strawberries with cream
Comrade Carl, we have proof that your son took part in putting up the anti-government posters in your building. We recommend you admit he did it and turn him in.
You made the right choice, Carl. In light of your admission, we're going to transfer your son to the Department of Corrections.
Then provide us with any other culprit within 24 hours or you're fired!
Comrade Carl, there is anti-government propaganda in your building!
Good news, Carl. Patrick is coming home!
You're wrong! My son is no rebel!
Our new technology set him straight.
Okay. But promise me you won't kill him!
He won't be punished...severely.
You're making a big mistake, Carl…
AGREE
REFUSE
Remove at once!
We've heard Inga Birkenfeld died. We know it was an accident, but that doesn't mean you can neglect your duty.
We need to know more about our citizens to prevent such occurrences.
Therefore, provide five tenant characteristics ASAP.
Examine the building and talk with your tenants immediately. DO NOT mention the current danger; we don't want to spark a panic.
Carl, there's a code orange alarm in the city!
You might have an explosive device in your building!
Carl, what happened to Inga Birkenfeld? How could she leave the country?
That was a rhetorical question. Your tenants are your responsibility.
One more incident like that, and you'll end up in jail.
She was supposed to do her job! You are therefore fined.
LAD?
If you commit more than the acceptable number of violations, you will be laid off.
You must go to the Experimental Cloning Center for standardization.
In five days, an investigator will arrive at your building to pick up your notes and documents.
If the number of violations you commit is within the acceptable limit, you will not be laid off.
Zero violations! Great job! You are a valuable employee!
Loyalty Assessment Department. It will take three days to process. Wait for the results, Carl.
Carl Stein, this is the official notification of your upcoming performance assessment.
You have failed the loyalty assessment. You have comitted more than the maximum number of allowable violations.
You have passed the assessment. You have not exceeded the maximum number of allowable violations. Continue working.
All of the paperwork and notes the investigator collected for your case have been transferred to the LAD.
You will also be arrested for sabotage. Is that clear, Carl?
We are very disappointed. Your ride is on its way. Farewell, Carl.
Carl Stein! These are your assessment results.
Remember, there's room to grow.
And don't leave the city. Understood?
What will be the results of the assessment?
Thank you for your work!
What are the results of the assessment?
I see. What if it's the other way around?
Goodbye, Carl.
Yes. Thank you...
That makes sense.
Since your son is underage, you'll be fined $5,000 for the damage he did to the Central Bank.
Your son, Patrick Stein, took part in the Central Bank robbery and was killed by police.
Pay attention, Carl. Your son is a minor, so you are responsible for his actions.
Citizens thinking they could leave our Great Country illegally were neutralized.
I'm talking about Prof. Gorchik's family. Have you heard this name?
Make sure his imaginary grief doesn't lead him to breaking the law.
There was an unpleasant incident at the border today.
Carl, we bring you sad news.
That's what I wanted to discuss.
My son was Andrea Gorchik's friend.
Our condolences.
Goodbye.
He's a printing specialist, and will print brochures critizing the current state goverment.
We're planning to go on strike at the factory in the near future and need those brochures. It won't work without them.
This is a difficult time... He might be framed or lured to the other side.
I'll send the money to your account. Please help comrade Grubic the best you can. He's doing an important thing.
What do you think of reports written by one family member to turn in another? Is it OK?
If you had tried to distribute them during the strike as planned, you'd have become a mockery.
All we need to do is use that technological miracle to broadcast our ideas.
All you have to do is find a way to change the frequency.
Not necessarily, Carl. You just need to agree to be ready to help our movement.
You have kids, and therefore must know what it means to sacrifice yourself for the sake of future generations.
All I want from you is an explanation about which unit you're discussing.
Oh, no! He printed the brochures. But the content is...a little different.
As you know, the current government is unwilling to change.
It's hard to miss it: it keeps going day and night.
Our children will have a society where they won't be jailed for their choices.
Total control of people, ridiculous bans on everything, no freedom of speech...
What happened? Why are these horrible fairy tales being broadcasted instead of our program?
What about your job, Carl? What normal society can count it appropriate?
The worst part is the content that rig is cramming into our people's ears.
People shudder at night when they hear the slightest sound. They're afraid someone will come and take them away.
That's not good. We wanted to use the device, not break it.
As soon as we hear the program we need, you'll receive your payment.
The mobile propaganda unit blew up! Was that your work, Danton?!
I'm afraid your refusal can lead to unpleasant consequences for both of us.
I know how to cheer you up. We'll send you a small amount of money as compensation.
You can earn the money you so desperately need for your family.
Find an apartment in your wonderful building for our faithful comrade.
Describe your perception of the state of our country. I must know why I'm putting myself at risk.
I knew it! There IS something behind your chatter about a better tomorrow.
What happened? Why didn't you do anything with that talking box?
That was such an easy assignment! I'm afraid our friendship is threatened now.
What if I refuse to deal with you? And report you to the quarter?
Will you offer to sacrifice someone else? Me, for example?
If you don't force me to help the revolutionary movement...
To hell with it; I'll do it. It doesn't look hard.
No! I will not take part in your shady activities!
Do you realize what I'll have to listen to from my superiors now?!
Our team needs your help again.
I do the job I was assigned. I don't have a choice.
But we have a plan that will advance our cause.
Antoine Grubic? I'll see what I can do.
Why do you need an explanation, Carl? You already know everything.
I have a family. I must know what you're getting me into.
His name is Antoine Grubic. He will stay in the building for about a week.
Should I even mention that the job will pay well?
Don't tell him what we know. He must do what he has to.
You've surely noticed the propaganda near your building.
That's too bad, Carl. Take care of yourself and your family.
This will be the beginning of our collaboration.
Antoine leaves today. Don't miss tomorrow's newspapers!
Protect him, Carl. Don't let him do what cannot be changed.
I'll call you in a couple of days to see how you're doing.
What do I get in return? Cards for clothes? Food? Soap?
The lack of sleep is the least of the evils this job visits upon me.
As far as I can see, I have no choice.
We're trying to make the world a better place, Carl.
Good afternoon, Carl. This is George Danton.
Good news! An important day is coming!
Thanks, Carl! The New Tomorrow movement will not forget this!
I couldn't find the necessary frequency.
Let's say I agree... How much will you pay me?
I don't want to kill anyone...
None of the tenants can sleep well!
That wasn't us, Carl. I swear!
You should have received the money already.
The New Tomorrow movement. Why are you being sarcastic, Carl?
Help us and spy. Do you understand me?
You did the right thing when you told me everything.
It's impossible with the current government.
We'll owe you if you hide him.
Our unit has friends everywhere.
Antoine is very important to our unit.
We might have become best friends.
I've thought this was your work, Carl.
You always have a choice! Help us, Carl!
One can fry eggs without breaking them.
Great, Carl! Be careful!
I repeat: we have friends everywhere.
What's your unit's name?
Unit of Confident Revolutionists?
Your person turned out to be a diversionist.
Is that a pirate radio station?
Grubic tortured me with orders.
No, your protégé is doing fine.
I'm disappointed in you, Carl.
What's going on, Carl?!
Hello, Carl. This is Danton.
Do you have information for me?
Are you threatening me and my family?!
I don't know what you're talking about.
You're very smart, Carl.
Of course not, Carl. How could I?
I really don't have a choice...
Yes, I understand you.
He didn't print the brochures, did he?
Where did you take my number?
Do you think I'm an idiot?
Remember: frequency 101.9.
What do you want from me?
I never doubted you.
ASK ABOUT THE PERSON
ASK ABOUT THE REWARD
TALK ABOUT THE COUNTRY
Thanks, Carl.
AGREE TO HELP
Who's that?
Hello, Carl!
Now what?
Goodbye…
How?
Trust me, you'll have time to sleep in after we've dealt with those social parasites!
Aglow has always been a small town; it basically ceased to exist after that "operation."
But you said there would be a lot of people! I hope this will give you peace of mind.
This man might turn out to be a general specializing in suppressing peaceful protests.
The main enterprise, the clock factory, closed. Now it's a ghost town.
Yes, he's a retired general; I think he's supposed to lecture at the university.
Over 600 people dead and several thousand injured.
You're absolutely right. Among the other things, the Butcher was in charge of the Toucan operation.
I know it was a hard decision to make. Things like that always leave a mark.
Sorry, it's not easy for me to suppress me emotions. My nephew died there…
Let me guess... You want me to find something confirming your theory?
And I've heard he's scheduled to give a speech at the stadium...
We've heard there's a certain Airel Johnson living in your building.
Find proof he took part in that operation!
This monster escaped due to your inaction! Are you happy?
Two years ago, he practically drowned that town in blood!
It's just a matter of time until more innocent people are killed!
First they were deprived of their minds, then their future…. They're nothing but meat now.
We've long known him as the Aglow Butcher.
Four hundred rookies against a battalion of tanks!
Carl! I can't thank you enough…
I can't remember when I last slept, Danton.
If I'm not mistaken, this is a cover-up.
And that's not the only case!
Call me if it's him.
Carl, it's Danton again.
And was rewarded for this!
Damn you, Carl!
What operation?
It was a real bloodbath.
My condolences...
The medicine is behind the flower pot on the first floor. Our courier put it there.
As soon as Antoine is safe, I'll give you the medicine.
She needs medicine I can't get here, Liebespirit.
Danton, you know my daughter is sick.
TALK ABOUT MARTHA'S MEDICINE
Can you get it?
No problem, Carl!
Now they're creating gas that can switch off the tentorium glands and damage the prefrontal cerebral cortex.
In any case, without her, the gas won't be ready for mass production. And you'll pay for that.
That bitch is the chemistry expert in charge of the secret experiments the Ministry of Control is conducting.
But this goes against our plans. If you don't want that to happen again, do as we say.
Exterminate Inga Birkenfeld, or next time it will be 10 bombs instead of one.
People like that don't know guilt or sympathy. So it will be used against our own.
We told you there would be a reckoning if you didn't help us with Inga.
That gas turns people into obedient tools; they have no fear and experience no moral dilemmas.
They're going to turn future generations into perfect workers and soldiers.
We spent a fortune locating Birkenfeld. You'll have to make up for this.
And remember, Carl, if you fail, the next bomb will go off in your apartment.
Sorry to upset you, Carl, but you can't make up for our spending.
You're insane! I'd never let that monster go! And I did almost everything I was asked to do!
You're a smart man; you'll figure something out.
I believe some money would help you forget what happened.
Listen and don't interrupt. You managed to defuse the bomb.
We'll believe you this time, Carl. But this isn't our last conversation.
If that will placate what's left of your morals, then OK…
Unfortunately, we'll have to use you as a sample case.
Inga Birkenfeld moved out; we're cancelling our offer.
You're right; it's a weapon. But it's not what you think.
Relax! Not yet. But this isn't our last conversation.
Go to hell! I will not blow up a building full of people!
Inga Birkenfeld left the country! Did you help her?
We don't care for your tenants - except for one.
Great job.
Why? What do you have against her?
All I needed was a little more time.
I couldn't do anything! I'm a simple man!
We're almost convinced you helped her.
Is my family still in danger?
Is that a new weapon of war?
EXCUSES (-500 reputation points)
No way, Carl. You go.
You're a dead man, Carl…
To hell with you! Choke on it!
TELL THEM TO GO TO HELL
Stay in touch.
She must be stopped!
ASK ABOUT THE BOMB
How?
Go to hell!
Yes. Who is this?
Carl Stein?
