I have something to tell you, Maria, but I don't know how...
Did you find Zlata's parents?
No, but I'm getting close. There's a problem, though. Bruno Hempf has the information we need, but he wants you to pay for it.
How much does he want?
It's not a matter of how much, it's a matter of what. I can't even think of a way to tell you this, you being a lady and all...
He... Well...
Say no more. I know what you mean. What else could we possibly expect from that lustful jerk!
He wants to get laid, like last time.
Well, in general, you're right...
Don't look at me like that, Hector! The last time, I had to - for Klaus!
I couldn't stand to see him withering anymore, aching so badly to have a child. I didn't want our marriage to fall apart...
And that fat bastard started groping me at that charity reception where Klaus and I met! I hate that swine!
Oh, how ecstatic he was when I came to him begging for help! His cheeks were flapping in anticipation!
Maria, you don't have to tell me...
Shut up, Hector! Zlata's presence in our lives has cleansed me of every speck of dirt that soiled me as I did what I had to do.
Love erases every sin committed for the good of a child, including both past and future transgressions!
Tell Hempf I will do what he wants.
I ask just one more thing of you, Hector. Please don't tell my husband about this. He's far too sensitive to survive it.
He wants money. Lots and lots of money.
Oh... Talk with Klaus. I'm sure he'll come up with whatever is needed.
Our daughter is more important than money.
DISCUSS BRUNO HEMPF'S PROPOSAL
This isn't the first time you've had to do this?
That's none of your concern. I'd do anything to save my daughter.
Hector! Why did you tell Klaus about Bruno's proposal?!
He's furious! He said he'll leave me if I give Bruno what he wants!
I'm sorry, Maria, but I couldn't keep that from him.
As disgusting as it is, it was an easy way to find out about Zlata's parents!
What am I supposed to do now?
I'll think of something.
He wants his nephew to replace your husband at the Ministry.
He wants Klaus to quit.
I'm sure Klaus can find similar work... Did you talk with him already? If not, please do. Tell him everything.
My husband knows what to do!
DISCUSS ZLATA'S REAL PARENTS
I pray they're still alive - either of them!
Let them be alive and well!
Finding them will be half the battle. We'll also have to convince them to become donors.
I'll beg on my knees. I'll do anything they want as long as my baby is saved!
I have the information you need! Zlata's biological parents are Jacob and Louisa Manishek.
What a coincidence!
My prayers were answered! They're not just alive and well, they're our neighbors!
I hope they'll be willing to save our girl... Klaus will talk with them.
Thank you, Hector!
DISCUSS DONATING BLOOD
This is madness! I don't understand the reason behind all of these inspections!
We live in astonishing times. Sometimes, I think things couldn't possibly get worse...
Then the Ministry issues a new directive, and I see that I was wrong. It can always get worse - far worse!
DISCUSS WAR
I hope the war will be over soon...
DISCUSS THE MANISHEKS
I don't know how I would respond to a request to donate blood for a long-deceased daughter...
I just hope they'll say yes. This is Zlata's only chance.
DISCUSS ZLATA AND LOUISA MANISHEK
Have you heard about Louisa taking Zlata?
I'm torn to pieces! On one hand, I'm happy Zlata is alive and well...
On the other, I'm furious at Louisa! How could she abduct my child?
She's her mother, just like you are. What would you do in her shoes?
I didn't say I don't understand her. But I'm still mad!
I miss my baby so much... I wish they'd find her and bring her home!
DISCUSS LOUISA MANISHEK AND ZLATA'S DEATHS
Maria, I'm very sorry for your loss...
I can't believe Zlata is gone... This is wrong... So wrong... I don't know how to deal with it.
As for Louisa, I'll pray for her. She was only trying to save her daughter... My daughter... OUR daughter!
I'd give my life to bring Zlata back!
END CONVERSATION
ASK ABOUT KNOWING BRUNO HEMPF
Do you know Bruno Hempf, Maria?
Why do you ask?
He's my boss, and he…mentioned you.
I see… I'd change the subject, if you don't mind.
I'd rather forget the circumstances of our meeting.
ASK WHAT SHE WANTS
Did you want something?
Hector, we've got enough on our plates as it is; now there's bed bugs in the apartment!
SELL THE CHEMICAL (-250 reputation points)
I have a great spray for that! It's only $500.
Okay, I'll take it.
You've got to do that for free, Hector! That's your job!
CALM DOWN
Are you sure? Where could they possibly come from?
I'm sure.
OK, Maria, I'll see what I can do.
He'll be waiting for you in the same place he was last time.
ASK FOR ZLATA'S DNA
Maria, as you know, Klaus asked me to find Zlata's biological parents.
I need something with her DNA. Nowadays, scientific progress makes it possible to compare the samples with the database.
Oh, right, Klaus mentioned this. Will that lollipop do? She's been shewing on it the day before.
Sorry, Hector, I can't help crying…
TALK ABOUT THE BEDBUGS
Can you exterminate them?
Hello.
GREET KLAUS
Hello, Klaus. How are you?
Fine. And you?
I wish I could say happy birthday, Hector, but given the latest news, you simply have my deepest condolences.
I never would've guessed you were 85. You look much younger!
The problem, Klaus, is that I'm not even 65!
What? But... How was I wrong?
You weren't wrong, Klaus. The Ministry is.
Oh! So they'll fix their records, and you'll have plenty of time before having to visit the horrid Euthanasia Center!
Who knows? Maybe it won't even be around in a few years. I'm sure this is a temporary measure!
There's nothing more permanent in our world than temporary solutions.
The Ministry of Care called. They think their records are correct.
And even if they realized they made a mistake, no one would admit it...
Because the Great State and the Wise Leader don't err... My God, Hector, I'm sorry!
Don't worry about it. It's my life, and my problem. You've got enough on your own plate.
All we can do is pray nobody in the Ministry spills coffee on the records that show your age, or the ages of your children.
ASK ABOUT THE BUILDING
I know this building used to belong to your family. What was it like?
It didn't just belong to my family - my great-grandfather and his son built it!
It was so beautiful in its prime! I remember orange trees blooming in the orchard...
Alas, there's nothing left of its former beauty. The Ministry long ago turned the orchards into tarmac.
ASK ABOUT THE WEATHER
How's the weather?
Terrible! I haven't seen the sun for weeks.
That kind of mirrors our lives, doesn't it?
ASK ABOUT HIS FAMILY
Tell me about your family, Klaus.
As you know, my wife's name is Maria. She's a literature teacher. Our daughter, Zlata, is six. We're already looking for a school for her.
That said, the Ministry might implement mandatory allocation, which means she'd probably go to the nearest School of Patriotic Upbringing.
I don't have any other family. At least no one who's not in jail.
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to upset you.
Ahhh... I'm an economist at the Ministry of Finance. I have access to a variety of statistics.
It's been noted recently that every citizen has a relative who's in jail...
...or in a labor camp, or who's been executed.
By the way, the department that made the discovery was disbanded and everyone went to jail - except for the supervisor. I think he's related to someone important.
And you, Hector? Do you have any family?
Yes, I have an adult son, but he lives far away. He's helping to build a railroad up north.
It takes six months for mail to reach him, provided it doesn't get lost along the way. I don't get to hear from him much.
But at least he's alive and not in jail.
I'm glad for that.
ASK ABOUT HIS WORK
Are you an economist?
Yes, and a good one at that. I've loved numbers since I was kid. It's the perfect job for me!
Though I sometimes catch myself thinking that people are skeptical about the statistical data I compile.
What do you mean?
Did you know, Hector, that for each newborn, four soldiers are killed in action?
Or that our economy is based on the support of the Ministry and satellite service jobs?
These people produce nothing but new laws and directives. I say this, even though I myself am employed by the Ministry!
Or how about this: 30 percent of our workforce is in jail, and another 10 percent is busy guarding those jails...
Klaus, there was a time when I'd just nod and go record that information.
But now... I don't think I'll be around for more than a couple of weeks. So let me give you some advice...
Never share that information with anyone. If you do, they'll come for you.
Oh, my... I didn't realize...
You've heard enough. I understand. Keep it to yourself, and everything will be fine.
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
Do you want something?
I would like to me a request, if I may.
Go ahead.
Zlata will soon turn six. I'd like to throw her a party!
Ever since she saw the fireworks on the Day of World Happiness, she won't stop talking about seeing more!
Can you acquire some for her?
I'll see what I can do.
DELIVER THE FIREWORKS
Here you go! Please be careful!
I hope the quality is good.
Unbelievable! You got them!
Thank you, Hector!
I'm still working on it...
You know the Ministry only recently lifted the ban on fireworks.
DISCUSS HIS WIFE'S INFERTILITY
Klaus, I found out Zlata isn't your biological child...
Hector, out of respect for your age, I won't raise my voice at you...
But I will ask you to mind your own business! She means as much to us as any child would to his or her biological parents! We tried for so long to have a child of our own...
I don't want to even discuss that! Just forget it! Never mention it again!
DISCUSS THE ACCIDENT
I was sorry to hear about the car accident, Klaus! How is your daughter doing?
She's in critical condition but there's a chance she'll survive. She needs a bone marrow transplant.
We're raising the funds for her surgery now. As for a donor...
DISCUSS ZLATA'S CONDITION
How's Zlata doing?
She's in critical condition. If only there was a one-in-a-million chance to find her real parents...
I'd be grateful until the day I die, Hector.
How's she doing?
Not well. She needs a doctor ASAP...
How's Zlata doing?
She passed away. My God, it's unbearable! Parents should not have to bury their kids!
I... I'm worried about Maria... She's on the brink of a nervous breakdown.
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
Did you hear that my daughter was hit by a car? It was such a tragedy.
I need your help. She needs a bone marrow transplant from a donor. The doctors say only a blood relative would be an appropriate match.
So what's the problem? Can't you do that for your child?
Well, we adopted Zlata, and it wasn't completely legal.
So we can't find her real parents through the usual channels.
I had no idea! How can I help?
If only you could use your connections to find her real parents...
Your boss, Bruno Hempf, helped with the adoption. And now we can't get an appointment with him...
I can't promise anything, Klaus, but I'll try.
Did you know our daughter was hit by a car?
I'm sorry for yelling at you. I need your help. She's our beloved child...
If you could use your connections to find her real parents, then she might live.
TELL HIM ABOUT BRUNO HEMPF'S PROPOSAL
Do you have any news for me, Hector? Did you speak with Bruno?
Yes, but you won't like what he's proposing...
He won't give me the information for free.
How much does he want?
He doesn't want money.
He wants a night with your wife...
WHAT? How dare he! I'll kill that fat bastard! Maria won't do it! There must be another way! Is there?
I'm sorry, Hector. I need to talk to my wife.
Money! A lot of money! $150,000 to be exact!
What? Is he insane? That damn greedy jerk! A child's life is at stake!
Don't kill the messenger, Klaus.
I'm sorry, Hector. I'm just shocked by the ease with which people will capitalize on the suffering of a child.
I'll get the money. I think I can, anyway. Tell that fat bastard he'll have it by tomorrow.
Be careful, Klaus.
What do you want?
It's over, Hector. I tried to steal the money at work, but I got caught.
I told you to be careful! So how come you're not in jail?
Thanks to my many years of service to the Ministry, I have a lot of connections. I called in a few favors.
They covered up my crime, but I lost my job.
All is not lost. Hempf won't mind that outcome.
He wanted his nephew to take your job.
THEN FIND OUT WHO ZLATA'S PARENTS ARE - ASAP!
What does he want?
He wants his nephew to have your job. If you quit, he'll give you the information you want.
Damn! I know his nephew. He came to us a month ago looking for work.
He'd be worthless as an economist! He can't add two and two!
The Ministry of the Economy is awash with nepotism. No wonder our economy is sinking like a leaky boat.
How am I supposed to provide for my family?
Klaus, to even have a family to provide for, you must first save it.
You're right, Hector! I'll find another job after we save Zlata.
I'm ready to tell that leech I'll give up my job in exchange for the information I need.
I'm sorry, Klaus...
Don't apologize, Hector. You've already done more for us than all of the rest of the officials put together.
TELL HIM WHO ZLATA'S REAL PARENTS ARE
I have the information you need. Zlata's biological parents are Jacob and Louisa Manishek.
But... How is that possible?
The chances of living in the same house as them are infinitesimal. I could calculate them for you!
What am I talking about? Once again, we're facing the impossible... Our daughter is the Manishek's deceased child...
I'll go to him and tell him the truth.
I hope they'll agree to help.
Jacob Manishek listened to me tell him the story about Zlata and then told me to get the hell out of his apartment! Please, talk to him, or Zlata will die!
We're counting the hours she has left to live!
She needs a donor asap, but Manishek won't even listen to me...
I'll try, Klaus.
TALK ABOUT THE MANISHEKS
I have mixed feelings, Hector...
I'm sorry we obtained Zlata through the suffering of good people.
But please understand - it's not like we took the child from them. She was issued to us legally...
Issued? Like a bag of sugar?
How was that legal?
You're right. We had to, well, cut a few corners.
But that was because we were so far down on the waiting list.
If we had known they'd take Zlata from the Manisheks and tell them she died at birth, we never would have gone through with it.
I don't think you're being completely honest, Klaus, not even with yourself.
Then screw you! YES! We'd have taken her anyway!
Zlata... She saved us... She saved our marriage... She gave us a purpose!
I don't know how we could live without her.
Go away, Hector.
I'm furious! How could she?
How could she save our daughter only to take her from us? We raised her! That's theft!
I'm sorry to hear that, Klaus, but you sound like you bought Zlata in a store.
Perhaps she'll be happy there...
What are you saying, Hector?!
How can our daughter be happy with a stranger?!
Even though she's her biological mother, we are her parents!
As for us, we'll be unhappy for the rest of our lives...
DISCUSS LOUISA MANISHEK'S DEATH
I don't know what to say... That's horrible...
It's a real nightmare...
TELL HIM ABOUT MARIA'S VISIT TO HEMPF
I'm afraid I'm the bearer of bad news, Klaus.
I was asked to keep it a secret, but out of respect for you, I can't.
What happened?
In exchange for the identity of Zlata's biological parents, Bruno is demanding that Maria sleep with him.
Your wife went to Bruno Hempf to save your daughter.
Are you insane? What are you talking about?!
It's true. And it wasn't the first time, either.
Maria did the same thing when you were trying to adopt a child so you wouldn't have to wait.
Hector, I'm a decent person, so I won't strike an old man...
But you'd better tell your doctor to change your medication because the pills you're taking are making you hallucinate.
I'm out of here. And I have no desire to listen to that nonsense ever again!
END THE CONVERSATION
ASK ABOUT MONEY
What's the best way to store a large amount of money, Klaus?
I've no clue.
I have no money, therefore no issues with storing it.
ASK WHAT HAPPENED
I gave him the money. Now it's your turn.
I'm waiting for an official paper with the new appointment.
Do you know, what is it?
No, but I'm a good expert, I don't think that would be a problem.
The Ministry of Allocation said, since I'm an economist, I will be good at counting money.
Perhaps, they have a spot at the Treasury.
ASK HIM WHAT HE WANTS
Comrade Hempf? What brings you here?
A matter of urgent importance. A complaint we can't leave unattended.
The Manisheks... They're neglecting their son... What's his name?
Marcus?
Yeah, him. The police found him heading to the hospital to save some girl.
Who gave him the idea to run away?
No one...
That's unfortunate, comrade Hector. As the manager of this building, you should be aware of everything that's happening within it!
It doesn't matter now, though.
I'm here to tell his mother we're depriving her of custody and sending the boy to an orphanage.
As for you, mind your own business and get back to work.
TALK ABOUT AVOIDING EUTHANASIA
Comrade Hempf, are there ways to avoid the Blissful Sleep procedure?
I'm sure there are precedents.
Hector Medina, you sly fox. Do you think it's that easy to turn the wheel of fate?
What can you give to our Great State if not your life? What will you live for?
I have a son. I'd give anything to see him again.
Anything? Okay, what do you have?
I could get some money...
I could find a place at the Ministry Archive for you.
However, special conditions are placed on anyone who works there. You can never leave the building or retire - ever. So you won't be able to see your son.
Okay, Medina. The state needs financing in order to support the high living standards of its citizens.
I'll make an exception for you. Bring me $100,000, and someone else will receive the Blissful Sleep treatment in your place.
END THE CONVERSATION
PAY TO NOT GET EUTHANIZED
Comrade Hempf, I brought you money. Do you remember our agreement?
Yeah. Money for the lost sleep, so to say…
Give it here, Hector. I found a place for you. Hope you like paper.
A police squad will come for you in due time. Don't worry, it's a formality.
Will they beat me up?
They won't do anything you couldn't survive.
See you later, Hector.
GIVE ABSENTEE BALLOT
I brought you the paper you've been asking for.
Good, Hector. You're living up to my expectations… so far.
What will happen to Klaus Schimmer now?
He won't be able to leave the city. I want him to stay in Hellmer until I figure out what to do with him.
Klaus established some ties at his workplace; I need him close by until I deal with those ties.
Sounds threatening!
What do you care? Don't you have enough of your own problems, Hector?
If you don't want to wait, call the Euthanasia Center. That's one of the few state offices where there's actually no line to get an appointment.
Hello.
SAY HELLO
Hello, Hector. Do you want something?
I'm just saying hi.
Thanks! Do you know if there's a good toy store in the city?
Marcus' birthday is coming up, and all they have at the general store are wooden toys.
He really wants a rocket!
I'm afraid we don't have any toy stores.
Oh well. I guess I'll go back to the general store and pick something else.
You know, Jacob, they say wooden toys are safe. They're made of all-natural materials and they don't contain allergens.
All-natural materials? Yeah, right. Last winter, a buddy of mine ran out of coal and started to get cold...
He had to use any fuel he could find, even furniture.
Despite their son's tears, they had to burn his wooden horse, too.
That horse burned for eight days! Can you imagine that?
Eight days instead of one? That sounds like a holiday miracle!
Huh! As a chemist, I assure you that sounds like a devilish concoction of paraffines!
I doubt it's healthy for kids.
But it sounds like those wooden horses could come in handy in the winter...
Perhaps you're right.
DISCUSS ZLATA
Jacob, we need to talk.
It's a touchy subject concerning your family.
I'm all ears.
Don't ask me how I know, but your daughter - the child the Ministry said died at birth...
She's alive...
What?! How is that possible?!
I don't know if the hospital made a mistake or someone did something underhanded, but it's true...
Your daughter is alive. And another family adopted her.
In what can only be an incredible coincidence, she lives in our building. Her name is Zlata Schimmer.
What should we do?!
I'm not much good in matters like these, but I believe you shouldn't act hastily.
If I were you, I'd take some time to think things over...
You're right. I need to digest this first...
I can't believe Zlata is our girl! That's why she always reminded me of Louisa when she was young...
My wife and I met as kids. We lived next door to each other, went to the same school...
I hope you're able to keep a level head about all of this, Jacob.
Don't worry! I'm not planning to make a scene or somehow traumatize the child.
She has parents and loves them... You're right: this is a very touchy matter.
DISCUSS BECOMING A DONOR FOR ZLATA
Have you talked with your wife, Jacob? Why don't you want her to become a donor?
I did. But I'm sorry - I can't risk her life. I wish I could be a donor...
I just can't risk losing Louisa.
We both know what's going on in the hospitals nowadays. The risk of her not surviving the surgery is high.
Marcus wouldn't survive his mom's death! Neither would I...
Tell Klaus I'm sorry.
But you have the ability to save a life! Zlata is your daughter!
We buried her years ago and dedicated our lives to Marcus.
She was put into the hands of other people, and as good as they were, they couldn't keep her safe! And now they're trying to make us pay!
Still, Jacob, this is the life of a child! They have no other options.
Let it go! I won't let my wife donate - period.
ASK WHAT HAPPENED
Jacob! You're back?! What happened?
Yes, I'm back. It was just a silly mistake.
They locked me up without an explanation.
It looks like someone set me up.
Set you up?
I overheard them mention a report. So they arrested me until they checked it out.
It turned out to be a lie. I wish I knew who wrote the report! I got fired!
Jacob, I need to tell you something...
And there was no reason to fire me! They called it a preventative measure! Nobody gets reported for nothing! Bastards!
Jacob, I...
How am I supposed to put food on the table now?!
Jacob!!! Listen to me!!!
WHAT?!
You need to calm down. While you were away, Louisa... She went to the hospital... She didn't make it through the surgery, and neither did Zlata.
I'm sorry, but they're gone...
WHAT?! How could she have done that? I told her it was risky! Oh my God... This is a nightmare... Please, God, wake me up...
Louisa! My Louisa! I can't believe this...
And Marcus? Where's my son?! Answer me!!!
The Ministry took him to an orphanage..
Which orphanage? I'm still alive, and I'm not in prison! How dare they take him away! I must find him!
Comrade Hempf said you can't see him again because your loyalty index is zero.
I'm sorry, but they took away your custody rights...
NOOO!!! Damn you! Damn all of you freaking Ministry rats! Burn in hell!
Jacob, if there's anything...
You go to hell, too! I've lost everything! Absolutely everything! In one day!
Stay away from me, Hector. I mean it! Stay away!!!
Hector! Have you seen my wife and son? Why is our apartment empty? What happened? Talk to me!
Calm down, Jacob, I'll tell you.
Louisa left.
Left? Where did she go?
She's going to abduct your son from the orphanage. You and Louisa have lost custody...
Will she be back? What did she say?
I'm afraid not. She doesn't want you to look for her. I don't know where she's planning to go next...
What? Why?!
I think Louisa blames you for Zlata's death...
Damn it! I just wanted to do what was best for my family... What should I do now? Actually, what's the point of anything? My family - my whole life - is gone.
What do you mean she left? Where did she go? And where's Marcus?
She took Marcus with her.
She doesn't want you to look for her. I don't know where she's planning to go next...
Calm down! While you were away, Louisa went to the hospital for the surgery...
Damn it! Is she OK?
Yes, the surgery went well. Louisa and Zlata both made it. But I'm afraid I have some bad news...
Left? To go where? When will she be back? And where's Marcus?
She took both kids. And she doesn't want you to look for her.
She took our kids? That's called kidnapping!
She can't forgive you for refusing to help Zlata. She said, "He refused to save his own child. I can't stay with him."
That's what she said, verbatim. I'm sorry, Jacob.
DISCUSS THE WEATHER
What do you think about the weather?
What weather, Hector? Look outside! It's nasty and gray, like it always is...
That goddamn smoke from the factory won't let any sunlight through. The coal dust doesn't help, either.
DISCUSS EUTHANASIA
Have you heard of the Blissful Sleep?
Yes. Don't tell anyone, but I think it's pure madness.
Do you think it's...painful?
It should be! Just imagine: a man spends his life slaving away for his people and state.
And instead of well-deserved respect and retirement, he gets shot up with poison!
Besides, given how they deal with things, I doubt they have any decent medications left.
I wouldn't be surprised to hear that instead of a fast and painless procedure, it takes old people hours to die in agony!
Oh, my, Hector! I'm sorry! I heard about your birthday, but it didn't compute...
All the news on the TV seems to be about things that are happening far away - things that don't concern us or our loved ones...
I wish I could help you, but how...
It's OK, Jacob. I'll deal with it.
END THE CONVERSATION
Jacob! You're back!
Yes, I am. What happened, Hector? Where are Marcus and Louisa?!
While you were away, they had to find a way to escape the police. It's all because of the blood transfusion stations.
Oh, no! Did they have to take blood tests?
As far as I know, you forbid them to do that.
Exactly! I took our samples myself and secretly checked them in a biolab where a friend works...
I found the Traitor's Gene in Louisa and Marcus' samples. They wouldn't pass the tests and would be sent to the labor camp for traitors.
What jerk decided to measure patriotism on a genetic level? That's not science, it's bigotry!
All I know is a phone number: 379-974.
I think the people who hid your family would ask for something in return.
They can have whatever they want! Thank God they're safe! I need to do call them now. Thanks, Hector!
ASK ABOUT Louisa AND MARCUS
Did you find out where your wife and son hid?
Yes, but it didn't make my life any easier. They were captured, Hector!
Those rascals are holding them hostage!
My God! What do they want?
I don't know... I was told to sit still and wait for a call.
I can't call the police because the first thing they'll do is check Marcus and Louisa for the Traitor's Gene.
So, I'm hog-tied. All I can do is wait for the call and hope those people have a whit of mercy.
I'm so sorry, Jacob.
Do you have any news about your family?
I can't and won't discuss that with you...
PERSUADE (-500 reputation points)
I feel guilty, Jacob. I didn't know it would turn out like this. I just wanted to help.
I don't blame you. I didn't have much of a choice, either. It was either that so-called "shelter" or a labor camp.
I don't know which one would be worse. And I... I have to do horrible things to keep my wife and son alive.
I have to make drugs for those bastards, which they're going to distribute around the country.
That's not why I learned chemistry! But I can't stop! If I do, Louisa and Marcus will die.
But that's how things turned out, Hector! So I'm asking you to do one thing - stay out of my way...
I'm terribly sorry, Jacob...
Go to hell, Hector! And stay out of my way... If you interfere again, Louisa and Marcus could die!
That's your right, Jacob.
You're back, Jacob!
Hector! How did my wife and son come to be arrested?
They didn't go to the station for the blood test, so they were arrested for failure to report.
My God! They should not have done that!
I took our samples myself and secretly checked them in a biolab where a friend works...
I found the Traitor's Gene in Louisa and Marcus' blood. Now they'll be checked and sent to the labor camp for traitors!
My poor Louisa... My poor Marcus... They won't be able to withstand the rigors of those camps! They're as good as dead...
I'm so sorry, Jacob!
Go to hell, Ministry rat! You're as heartless a servant as any of those bastards!
I bet there's a special spot in Hell for you!
Go on…
Klaus Schimmer came to me, saying weird things… I thought he was drunk, but now I see, why he wasn't himself.
Any news about your family?
ASK ABOUT FAMILY
How are you, Jacob?
I know you had something to do with that tragedy.
Hello.
RETURN THE GREETING
Hi, kiddo...
Hi, Uncle Hector. Can I play with your kitty? It's so cute...
Do you have candy?
I don't have any candy, but you can play with my cat. He's old, so you have to be gentle.
He's old? So, he will get the Blissful Sleep treatment soon?
*cough*
Perhaps...
Then I'll be very gentle!
They said on TV that the elderly should be led with kind persistence to that big building.
I'll pretend our house is a huge palace!
ASK ABOUT THE GAMES SHE PLAYS
What are you playing?
I'm sad. Mommy and daddy had a fight.
Don't worry, they'll make up.
Really? Good, 'cause I don't feel like telling my kindergarten teacher about their fight.
I don't want to do that at all!
You know what I do want to do? Learn more about astronauts! Marcus told me that astronauts who don't have any oxygen in space go "Pop!" That made me laugh...
I laugh every time I think about an astronaut going pop in his... his...
Spacesuit?
Yeah...
ASK WHAT SHE WANTS
What do you want, Zlata?
Can you build us a sandbox - one filled with unlimited toys?
And real shovels for digging up treasure? And edible sand?
With a real shelter below it - one with the Wise Leader in it?
And with your cat not going there...
I'm sorry, Zlata, but I'm not planning on building a sandbox.
Why not? This building is boring without a sandbox! I have to play with the same things every day!
A sandbox would make it so much better!
Just think of all the things we could make out of sand! Sand pies, sand cakes, more sand pies...
I simply don't have the resources.
Marcus and I have decided to start a petition to build a sandbox and then send it to the Ministry.
But that would make my work here much harder!
What good are you if we can't have a sandbox?
I'm sorry you feel that way.
Not as sorry as we are about not having a sandbox! Our parents pay taxes, so you have to listen to us!
DISCUSS THE MANISHEK'S BOY
Who's your friend?
Marcus, our neighbor. He's fun and nice, and we were born on the same day!
We play games! We played firefighters yesterday!
But his dad took the matches away from us. He ruined our game!
Your dad did the right thing,. Matches aren't toys!
You don't understand... How can I be a firefighter if there's no fire to fight?
The whole point of being a firefighter is to make sure there are NO flames anywhere!
Then build us a sandbox; nothing will burn in it.
END THE CONVERSATION
Hello!
RETURN THE GREETING
Hello, Hector! How are you?
I've been better. If you by chance have a bottle of imported wine, I'll feel MUCH better soon!
Oh, no, no, no! The Ministry has banned imported wine. We don't break any laws!
I'm glad to hear that.
ASK ABOUT HER FAMILY
Do you live alone?
What about your son?
No, I'm not talking about that. Does he go to school?
ASK ABOUT WORK
ASK ABOUT THE BALL
TELL HER ABOUT THE TRAGEDY
TELL HER ABOUT ZLATA
ASK ABOUT JACOB'S REACTION
Is there really no way to persuade him? She's his daughter!
TALK ABOUT THE SURGERY
TALK ABOUT MARCUS
What are you going to do now?
TALK ABOUT THE ADDRESS
Louisa, I know where Marcus was sent. He's in Orphanage 9.
END THE CONVERSATION
Sorry, that's not my best joke. Believe me, I'm on your side. I hardly drink at all.
No, I live with my brilliant husband and wonderful son! My husband is a chemical biologist... At least he used to be when worked at the chemical plant.
After the Ministry closed the plant, he started teaching chemistry.
Marcus? No, of course not! He's too small to work!
No, not yet. He'll be seven soon. We're waiting to find out where he's going to go to school. Marcus is very smart. I think he has the potential to become a Minister!
Does anyone else live with you? I'm sorry for prying, but my duty is to know as much as possible about the tenants of the house.
You have to maintain order - I understand. No, it's just the three of us. Although I gave birth to twins.
Unfortunately, the other child, Marcus' sister, died during childbirth... That's what they told me in the maternity ward.
I'm so sorry! The last thing I wanted to do was open old wounds.
It happened a long time ago. There's no need to apologize.
This question is merely routine: Where do you work?
I don't work. I'm on a leave of absence due to my health. I stay home and take care of our son.
It's too bad the kindergartens are closed. Marcus gets bored from time to time.
Doesn't he play with the neighbor girl?
With Zlata? Yes. They get along well, like two peas in a pod. I like her. She's well-bread and always polite.
It's a pity Marcus doesn't have a sister. They'd have fun together... I'd have more fun, too.
Do you have a ball?
Yes, my son always plays with it. Why do you need it?
Your neighbor from apartment 1 asked me to get a ball for her daughter. Zlata's birthday is coming up.
Maria? It's strange she didn't ask me in person. We've been celebrating our kids' birthdays together for years.
I'm sorry, Hector, but I can't take my son's favorite toy from him, even for a reason as good as this. Toys are rare nowadays.
That's why we don't allow him to take them outside.
I understand. I was hoping you had two balls.
I have an idea! Why don't they play together? I'll tell Marcus he and Zlata can play with any of his toys.
That sounds great! I think both kids will love that. Thank you, Louisa!
Did you hear about what happened to your neighbors? Their daughter was in a terrible accident; she's in critical condition at that hospital. They're looking for a donor.
Yes, Maria told me. How horrible! I was already scared to let Marcus go outside and play, but now...
Marcus thinks he did something wrong and is being punished, but I can't make myself let him out. It's too dangerous!
I feel sorry for our neighbors and wish we could help...
You could visit them more often...
You're right! I will.
Louisa, I have something to tell you, but I don't know how to say it...
Well... Zlata is your daughter.
WHAT? Hector, are you joking? How is that possible? I was told she died!
Are you confused? That's impossible! I don't believe you!
I checked twice! She's definitely your daughter. I don't know how that could happen.
Someone made a mistake. But that doesn't matter now. What matters is that you can save her!
How did she end up with the Schimmers? They went to Valverde for reproductive assistance...
I think they made that up so people wouldn't ask if they adopted Zlata.
So, Zlata is my daughter... Are you sure?
Absolutely!
I don't understand how, but I do want to help. Tell me what to do!
She's in bad shape; she needs a bone marrow donor.
Say no more, Hector. I'll be her donor!
Thank you! I'll tell everything to my husband! He'll be thrilled!
Louisa, what did Jacob say? Will you be a donor for Zlata?
I'm in despair, Hector. At first, Jacob was thrilled about the news. But when he found out that one of us had to be a donor, he became angry!
He said he wouldn't allow me to become a donor because the doctors would send Zlata and me to our graves.
He spent all night trying to talk me out of it, telling me about the awful conditions in our hospitals. He wants us to help, but he doesn't want us to risk our lives to do so...
He loves me and is afraid to lose me! My health is poor, and we do have to think of Marcus!
I'm sorry, but I can't do this against his will.
I couldn't persuade him. We need to find another way out, even if its illegal.
What do you mean?
What if my husband had to leave for several days? He used to travel as part of his work for the chemical plant.
Professors don't travel on business much...
I don't know what to do, Hector. I want to help my daughter, but I can't while Jacob is here.
Once he makes up his mind, that's it.
LEARN WHAT HAPPENED
Louisa, do you want to talk?
Hector, Jacob was arrested, and I don't know why! I hope they release him since he teaches at the school for the children of the Ministers.
Louisa, that's awful, but it also gives you an opportunity to save Zlata! Go to the hospital and tell them you'll be the donor.
Oh! You're right!
Tell my husband I'm doing this for the sake of our kids.
ASK WHY THEY DIDN'T HAVE THEIR BLOOD TESTED
Louisa, why didn't you have your blood tested? You know it's required.
Plus, the Ministry could hold me responsible for not making sure you showed up for the procedure.
Hector, Marcus and I can't have our blood tested. They'll check for the so-called Traitor's Gene.
And Marcus and I both have it.
If they test us, they'll arrest us immediately and send us to a reform facility from which no one has returned.
Help me!
PERSUADE (-500 reputation points)
Louisa, the Ministry has already cancelled the directive about eliminating unreliable citizens. Everything would be fine. You have nothing to fear.
Are you sure? Why didn't I hear about that? If I had, I wouldn't have hid for so long!
I'm absolutely sure! I have access to every government directive.
OK... I believe you, Hector.
I still don't think it's a good idea.
OFFER TO HELP
Louisa, I'll try to help you. If you can't allow your blood to be tested, then you need to hide.
But where? Do you have a safe place? Or ties to someone who does?
No. We need someone who knows how to break the law and won't draw attention to himself.
There's someone in this building who's intimately familiar with the black market.
Thank you! You're saving our lives! You're a nice person, Hector!
You're too kind, Louisa. I don't know how this will turn out.
TELL HER ABOUT THE SAFE PLACE
I talked to Nathan Kehler. You've probably seen him near the building.
Yes. I've bought lollipops for Marcus from him.
He gave me a phone number. If you have something to offer, the people on the other end will offer you asylum.
But he warned me that those people are very dangerous. I can't make such an important decision for you, so I'm going to give you this phone number and let you decide for yourself: 379-974.
Make up your mind.
What could be more dangerous than our police?
You'd be surprised. I'm begging you to be careful! Those people are no walk in the park.
OK...
ASK WHAT HAPPENED
Did you want something?
I called that number and talked to a very nice man. We made a deal! He even didn't tell me the price!
That sounds suspicious...
Oh, no! When I told him Jacob is a talented chemist, he became very excited!
He said it would be his honor to help the wife of the man who made the first cough syrup that both stopped a cough and tasted good!
I didn't know that about your husband...
He doesn't like to brag about his success. He had his own laboratory before he became a professor.

An underhanded colleague took the credit for some of Jacob's work and was promoted to supervisor. He then made work hell for my husband. That was a sad situation. Jacob was forced to quit and start working at the plant. Then the plant closed, too.
Now Jacob teaches gifted children, but I'm sure he misses his lab and the freedom of conducting experiments and breaking new ground!
I'm packing my things, Hector.
I left a note for Jacob. Please tell him everything if he doesn't find it.
Thank you for your help!
Be careful, Louisa.
You're not good at judging people, Hector. But that's what makes you such a nice man!
You worry about us. That's touching. Thank you for everything!
Hello, Louisa! It seems the surgery was successful!
Yes, we did it, thanks to you! Zlata is still in recovery, but she'll be released from the hospital soon.
Thanks for everything... I met someone in the hospital. They offered to help me...
I... I want to leave... Before Jacob returns...
What are you talking about?
I don't know why I'm telling you this... Perhaps I'm hoping you'll validate my decision...
Hector, when Jacob worked in the laboratory, he checked our blood just in case.
And he found the Traitor's Gene in my blood and the blood of our son... That means Zlata has it, too.
It's a miracle nobody checked her blood after the accident. As soon as our blood is checked...
...my kids and I will be sent to a labor camp.
I want to take both kids as far away from here as I can.
But Zlata is not your daughter officially!
Do you think I don't know that? I'm aware that the state will consider me to be a criminal!
But I must rescue them. They're mine...
What about your husband?
He refused to help Zlata when she needed us.
My gut says he won't like this idea, either, but I don't have the energy or the desire to persuade him otherwise.
Tell Jacob not to look for us.
Louisa, what happened? Why were you deprived of custody of Marcus?
He said Marcus ran away from home. But he rushed to rescue his sister... He's my little hero! How did he know? I didn't say a word to him.
Let's go! I need information! Bring it to me! I must know where he is! I won't abandon my son!
I beg you, Hector! I know you can help.
I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, Hector! You've been a tremendous help! My gratitude knows no bounds.
What's next, Louisa?
I become a criminal who kidnaps her own child and runs.
My God! What about your husband?
ASK WHAT SHE WANTS
I found bed bugs. I bet Marcus brought them in one of his bags, even though he won't admit to it.
Can you exterminate them?
SELL THE CHEMICAL (-250 reputation points)
Why poison the whole block? I have a great spray for only $500.
Kids are so expensive nowadays…. There you go.
Oh, no, I'm completely broke at the moment…
CALM DOWN
Are you sure? I have no clue where they came from!
I'm sure.
Don't worry, I'll take care of this as soon as I can.
TALK ABOUT THE BEDBUGS

RETURN THE GREETING
Hi, Marcus. How are you?
Hi, Hector. I'm fine.
Good boy. Seen anything suspicious lately?
Like what?
Like enemy spies? Or criminals? Or aliens?
Aliens? That's science fiction, and science fiction is banned!
You're a smart boy. Stay aware, son!
I'm more aware than anyone!
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
What do you want?
I have a great idea! Let's build a sandbox! They're cool, and everyone could play in it whenever they want!
I could play in a sandbox forever! They're the best thing ever!
Unfortunately, Marcus, it would be nearly impossible to build a sandbox. All of the sand we mine is used to build new apartment buildings. I doubt I could get any.
But everyone needs a sandbox! Kids, grown-ups - everyone! Even your cat would love it!
DISCUSS THE NEIGHBOR GIRL
Do you know Zlata in apartment 1?
Yeah! She's awesome! We played ball the other day. She had a good time! We're a lot alike. We even like the same things!
We both like the sandbox idea! Could you somehow make it happen?
I'm sorry, but no.
DISCUSS FIREWORKS
Did you like the fireworks?
Yeah! Too bad the roof didn't catch fire. The firefighters would have come!
TELL HIM ZLATA IS HIS SISTER
I have something sad to tell you, Marcus. Zlata is in the hospital; she's in bad shape.
No! We just played together! It can't be true!
I understand how horrible that is. But there's more. Can you keep a secret?
You bet! Dad once drank all the cognac mom was saving for the holidays and then told me to keep it a secret.
I didn't say a peep!
Do you realize you just told me?
Anyway...
Well... Don't tell anyone it was me who told you, OK?
I won't tell - I promise! Pinky swear!
Zlata is your sister. You were born on the same day, but she was taken from your mom.
What? She's my sister? Yahoo!!! I have a sister!
Unfortunately, she's very sick and needs a donor. Do you know what a donor is?
Yes. It's when one TV gets a lamp from another TV. You need to take something out of me and give it to her, right?
I'll do it! I'll save Zlata!
You're a brave boy, Marcus. Zlata is in Hospital 3, on Burnt Youth Street. You can visit her and tell the doctors you're her brother.
They'll surely let you in. But don't tell anyone, OK?
OK! Thanks! I'm going to save my sister!
END THE CONVERSATION
ASK WHAT HAPPENED
Marcus, what happened?
Uncle Hector, I'm hungry! Do you have any food?
Let's see.
GIVE MARCUS A SANDWICH
Here's a sandwich.
Thank you, Uncle Hector! I love sandwiches!
What is it, Marcus?
I'm thirsty.
What would you like? Some water?
Nope! I'd rather have lemonade!
Okay, I'll see what I can do.
GIVE MARCUS LEMONADE
Here's some lemonade, Marcus. It wasn't easy to come by!
Thank you!
What are you doing here?
I'm checking on you.
Dad says when people come uninvited, they're either policemen or thieves.
You don't look like a policeman, Uncle Hector.
But I'm no thief, either, sweetie. I'm the supervisor of this building.
Don't tell mom this place was a mess! I'll pick it up! We're fine.
Deal.
Let's play war!
Um, I'm not here to play; I need to see your parents. Are they home?
No, I'm here alone, playing war! It would be more fun if you played with me!
I have to go.
Too bad! I just built a trench! And this iron is my tank!
SAY HELLO
Good afternoon, Mark.
What's good about it?
It could be better. My rheumatism has flared up.
That's because you live in the basement. Dampness and cold are a curse at your age.
My age? I'm younger than you!
Really? According to my documents, I'm 20 years younger than you!
But how is that possible? You...
Look much older... Is that what you want to say? As a honorary archives worker, I can say it doesn't matter how young or old a person looks.
What matters is what's written on the documents. And I DO know how to work them. Hehehe...
ASK ABOUT THE LATEST NEWS
What's going on in this great country of ours?
People say there's no order in the Ministry of Order... Hahaha! Hey... I'm joking.
What do you want to hear, Hector? That everything is stable, and our country is racing toward a better tomorrow?
Don't you read the newspapers?
I'm in "no newspapers" mode.
I understand. I make cigarettes out of them.
Be careful, Mark. If you do anything with a newspaper besides read it, leave our leader's photos untouched.
Otherwise, you'll be given the full measure of justice for disrespecting the state and the rule of law!
You're a smart aleck, huh?
TALK ABOUT THE WEATHER
The weather hasn't been good this summer...
Who cares about the weather, Hector?
It's the same year-round. You should be used to it by now...
TALK ABOUT THE WAR
Have you heard any news from the battlefield?
Of course!
Our troops strike, the enemies drop back, and vice versa.
Do you think the war will ever end?
That's none of our business... Our job is to sit in the archives and sort out files.
I don't care what we have to issue: reports about how great the government is doing or death certificates - it's all the same to me.
We'd better just sit still and be happy that they don't haul us off because of our age.
ASK ABOUT THE INFORMATION
Could you do me a favor, Mark, and find one particular document in the archives? It's very important.
Important? How could anything of importance be in the archives?
I need to know who Zlata Schimmer's real parents are. She's at the hospital now and needs a donor, but Klaus doesn't know anything about her natural parents.
She's not their biological daughter? *cough* *cough*
First, they bring kids here from the orphanages, and then the entire building suffers from the noise and the crying.
Mark, this is about a child's life.
Yeah, I get it. But that's no easy task. Taking documents out of the archives is strictly prohibited. I won't do it for free, even for the sake of a child.
What do you want? Money?
Ha! Why would an old man like me need money? Besides, what can anyone buy in our country? Mended socks?
Listen... My wife wants a job at Cafeteria No. 389, but she doesn't have a health permit. According to the waiting list, she'll get one in two years.
Bring me the permit, and I'll bring you the documents you need.
Where could I find one? I don't know any cooks!
Aren't you the one who decides who moves into your building?
OK, Mark. I'll see what I can do.
ASK ABOUT THE STATE STANDARD FORM
Can I ask you about one thing, Mark? Can you bring me a state standard form? I need one for a good deed!
What kind of good deed? People don't ask for that form without a good reason. I bet someone is in a mess and wants to get off the hook!
Is it that so-called artist from the neighboring apartment?
Mark, I really need your help! That person will be executed for wasting the government's money...
Ha! I was right! He shouldn't have wasted money then! He's responsible for his own actions!
In the old days, people cut the hands off of thieves and then kicked the bastards out in the freezing cold.
Why were they so cruel?
So the thief would get a cold and be unable to blow his nose. How could he without his hands? It was torture! A thief would have the sniffles all the time!
Everyone knew who the thieves were - the ones with the sniffles!
That's silly. Wouldn't having no hands get the message across?
You're boring, Hector! I can't even enjoy telling you a tall tale!
OK! I've saw an old state standard form in the archive. Nobody will miss it.
Bring me a bottle of whiskey, and it's yours.
GIVE HIM THE BOTTLE OF WHISKEY
Mark, I have what you asked for.
Nice choice, Hector. The form is yours. Let me know if you need anything else.
GIVE HIM THE HEALTH PERMIT
Mark, I have what you asked for. It took a bit of work, but I got it.
That's great news! Now Rosa can get a job in the cafeteria. And I'll be able to spend some time without her buzzing in my ear.
I've always said a woman is like a chainsaw: she needs to work or she'll get dull - or cut off her husband's head!
What do you want in return for the health permit?
OK, here it is... Don't tell anyone where you got it!
I'll deny everything.
ASK WHAT HE NEEDS
Medina! That's awful! I found bedbugs in my bed today! Where did those little pests come from?
Solve this problem now or I'll complain about you to the Ministry!
Bedbugs? Where did they come from?
I have no idea! And I don't have the time to find out! We're too busy scratching ourselves!
If you don't deal with this as soon as possible, Hector, I'll drag my mattress to the basement of this building!
I'll also bring a jar full of cockroaches from the archives and release them into your basement apartment!
Calm down, Mark. I'll find a way to help you!
TALK ABOUT THE BEDBUGS
Did you take care of the bedbugs?
YES
There will soon be no trace of the bugs. The sanitation service will be here soon.
Good! They smell like cognac, which we don't have.
And we're tired of itching all of the time!
NO
I'll take care of it.
I'm waiting! I've already written the complaint, and it will take all of three minutes to send it.
TALK ABOUT DONATING BLOOD
Mark, every one must donate blood for the troops at the front line.
Will you go?
I've already donated so much blood to our great and glorious state that I can't spare another drop!
Of course.
TALK ABOUT EUTHANASIA
Have you heard about the Blissful Sleep procedure?
I have!
What do you think about it?
Rosa and I have a lot of time left before we have to go. Moreover, the law could be changed at any moment. Or - who knows? - our documents might get lost in the archives...
My wife and I are diligent citizens and are preparing for it just in case. We've already written our wills.
By the way, they say the Ministry of Beforehand Applications will be open soon. One can earn extra food cards for going early.
Do they think people would go to the Euthanasia Center EARLY in exchange for food?
I've seen people do all kinds of things for food.
TALK ABOUT ZLATA GETTING HIT BY A CAR
Did you hear about Zlata Schimmer, Mark? She was hit by a car!
Kids are always getting in trouble. They say an adult is a kid who accidentally survived.
I'm glad we have only one child. And I'm glad he's all grown up.
TALK ABOUT ROSE RANEK'S HEALTH
How's your wife?
It seems she's giving up. She recently said something like, "I'm dead! I'm burning from the inside!"
That's a troubling sign...
Yes. She used to say that when she was young. It seems she's gone mad.
TALK ABOUT MANISHEK
Do you know what's going on with our neighbor, Jacob?
I have no idea! He's as mad as a hornet! Perhaps it's because of his family.
We need to move him out! If he can't be his own man, he should be sent to the front lines.
Once there, he'll quickly learn his place.
END THE CONVERSATION
Is your memory playing tricks on you, Mark? We had an agreement about the personal records of the Schimmer's child.
SELL THE CHEMICAL (-500 reputation points)
Let's resort to local measures. I have that amazing spray for only $500!
Ah, what the heck. Give it here. At least, I'll stop itching!
Local, huh? How about I use my crutch locally? On your ribs, for example?
Get to work, lazy ass!
Good afternoon!
RETURN THE GREETING
How are you, Rosa?
My sciatica is killing me! It's so cold in our apartment!
Dear Hector, can you help with the heating somehow?
I'll do what I can. The lack of coal in our country makes it hard to keep a building warm.
We live near the mines, but receive coal only on a holiday!
Everything they mine is sent to the plants and the front lines.
I know, dear, but that doesn't warm me up. Sometimes, I'm tempted to grab all those old newspapers...
...the one with the photos of our Wise Leader. Mark keeps them but never uses them to make cigarettes. Our closet is full of pictures of him!
I want to take all those photos and make a big fire in the furnace just to be warm for a day.
You can't do that, Rosa! And don't tell anyone else what you just told me!
If someone turns you in, you'll be charged with disrespecting the patriotism of the workers.
What patriotism?
When it's time to clean the entrance hall, I see neither workers nor patriotism... When it's time to be offended, there they are!
TALK ABOUT THE COLD
It's been getting colder and colder. How do you feel, Rosa?
No better than I should be at my age. The pain in my back never goes away.
Mark says I need a warming balm, but where could I get one? We haven't seen mustard or pepper for 10 years.
GIVE HER THE BALM
If you want, I can give you an amazing warming balm, Rosa! It will heat you up in an instant!
Thank you, my dear! What is it? It says...
The warming balm, Merry Dracaris, will breath new life into your body...
I haven't seen this at the drug stores. Thank you! Take this in exchange for your help!
OFFER YOUR SYMPATHY
I'm sorry. I wish I could help, but I don't have anything. My apartment is freezing, too.
ASK WHAT SHE NEEDS
Do you want something?
The balm you gave me - it burned me!
What was it, Hector? My chest still feels like it's on fire!
You're exaggerating, Rosa! That couldn't be true!
So my clothes burned on their own? You owe me a new cardigan, Hector!
I'm afraid I don't have one. I meant well, Rosa.
Oh, darling, sometimes it's better to leave everything as it is.
Although I DO feel much warmer than before.
Isn't that good?
I guess, but sometimes, I feel so hot, I want to tear off my clothes!
But it's indecent to walk around naked, especially at my age! I'm no strapping barbarian riding a horse!
I'm sorry, Rosa. I have to go... Have a good day...
TALK ABOUT EUTHANASIA
Have you heard about the Blissful Sleep procedure?
Don't remind me about it. Perhaps they'll rescind it...
I doubt it.
If they want to save money, they could cancel everyone's pensions! Those who have kids would survive.
The kids would support their parents.
I've heard that's how they create jobs and drive the economy...
I don't understand the economy... I'm too old for all of that trickery anyway. Mark and I have seen a lot...
Remember my words - if a person receives nothing early in life, he or she won't want to work later on.
Hector! We have bedbugs in our apartment! How did that happen?
This has never happened before!
That's terrible!
It's a nightmare, Hector! Those little bloodsuckers are making us miserable!
I'll try to solve the problem as soon as possible!
Please do! Mark is furious. He wrote a letter of complaint about you and is threatening to send it!
TALK ABOUT ZLATA GETTING HIT BY A CAR
Did you hear about Zlata Schimmer, Rosa? She was hit by a car!
That's too bad! Poor girl! I can't imagine how her parents feel...
TALK ABOUT MANISHEK
Do you know what's going on with our neighbor, Jacob?
I do. He's in mourning...
He had a beautiful wife and son... They lived in harmony, he had a good job... And then everything was gone in a blink of an eye!
He lost everything! It's no wonder he's angry with the world. It's sad; they were nice people...
END THE CONVERSATION
Fancy meeting you here...
SAY HELLO
Hello, George. How's your job?
How could you call this a job? I'm wasting my life on this drivel!
Are you painting propaganda again?
Yes... It's not exactly what I dreamed I'd be doing as I studied the works of the great artists - and as I developed and nurtured my gift!
I'm beginning to doubt I even have a gift... I used to be sure I could create something brilliant...
And now... Do I still have it in me? Only Melpomene knows!
I'm sure this job is temporary. You'll have a chance to show the world your talent someday, George.
While I, George de Latour, agonize in anticipation of that favorable time, any narrow-minded gendarme can drag me through the mud with a kick of a jackboot.
The chastity of the ardent soul is at risk of dying on the vine of unscrupulous obscenity!
I'm afraid I no longer understand what we're talking about...
Like the Fates weave the web of human history, two people weave the thread of their conversation, not knowing where it will go...
TALK ABOUT CREATIVITY
How's your creative process coming along?
I'm a freelance artist! My tiffany-like nature is locked in a cage of primitive desires.
To be able to create something, I need to eat, but to eat, I need money. My art, my legacy - my very existence - hangs on the threads of these primordial needs.
What is a man when his only concern is eating and sleeping? An animal, and nothing more!
You're a starving artist! That's wonderful!
What do you know about these things Hector? If only I could paint on an empty stomach!
Some artists become quite famous after they die. But I don't think you're time is up, George.
Hector, if I don't comply with the government's orders, I will either starve to death or be imprisoned for having dissenting views.
The boat of creativity has crashed against the shores of the daily grind, and my growling stomach mutes my thoughts about celestial matters! How trivial!
How incredibly sad...
Please forgive my lofty speech, my friend. I did not want to upset you.
Perhaps I should go back to spoiling this paper with vulgar slogans.
TALK ABOUT THE STATUE
I saw a statue in your apartment...
Congratulate me, Hector! I've received an order to make a statue of our Wise Leader. This is a big deal!
If I deliver it on time, I'll be sitting pretty for a while. I won't have to worry about money, food - nothing!
I'll finally be able to devote myself to my art - to creating graceful, delicate shapes and marble curves!
Isn't marble given out only by order of the Ministry for creating busts and statues of our Wise Leader?
Damn! I forgot about that... There are so many busts of the Leader out there. They all look alike, too, like carbon copies of each other.
My freedom is a shadow, and I've long been a dumb vassal of his arrogant will...
I haven't heard about any quotas on alabaster...
Alabaster? Hector! You're a genius! Not as much of a genius as me, but still, that's a delightful idea!
I'll use alabaster! The plebs will finally understand what true art is!
TALK ABOUT A WOMAN'S STATUE
George, what are you making?
I already told you, Hector, I received an order to make a statue of our Wise Leader!
The Ministry is going to pay me enough to live carefree for a few years.
George, are you saying our Wise Leader is a woman?
So, you know everything? Oh my God!
Please, Hector, help me!
I'm dying of my love for the unforgettable Jeanne Oehrn...
If I don't die, then I'll be executed by a firing squad. Darts of love are less painful than cold, lead bullets, you know...
What do you want from me?
I fell head over heels for passion! Blindly and mindlessly love rushes, not knowing where it's heading...
I'm just a man with a warm heart and an open soul...
Which everyone is willing to trample with his muddy boots... George, I understand what you're saying, but, please, stay on point.
For me, every moment of life counts. This is not a figure of speech but my horrible reality!
I had nearly finished the statue of our leader when I was overcome with temptation...
...and I sculptured the face of my muse, my beautiful Jeanne, on the back of it. The stronger the passion, the sadder its end.
If the selection committee finds it, they'll shoot me!
The paper that proves conformity to state standards is more important to these monsters than human life!
Even statues are made according to state standards, Hector... Talk about taking a dagger to the heart of creativity...
TALK ABOUT THE STATE STANDARDS FOR THE STATUE
Do you have to follow state standards while making the statue?
Yes. I have to fill in a state standards form detailing my plans for the piece and then show it to the hollow-hearted selection committee.
Anything printed on paper and bearing a stamp is truth to them.
Even if I write that the leader should have a pinecone nose and woodpecker hands, they'll accept it!
Where can I find this form? I'm not a magician; I can't pull a rabbit out of a hat.
Ask the neighbors, call the authorities, do whatever you can! I beg you, please, help me!
I can't promise anything, but I'll try.
I thank you from the bottom of my heart!
I brought you a piece of stamped paper. Write whatever you want on it and the committee will accept your statue.
Hector, you're my savior! I will paint my next picture in your honor!
You said you need a state standards form...
Please hurry, Hector! My clock is ticking, and each second makes the movement of the timing mechanism louder and the end more inevitable!
ASK ABOUT THE STATUE
Hector! What a delight it is to see you! I owe you so much because of your help with the marble nonsense!
I'm very much obliged to you, which is why...
This is my humble gift to you – to thank you for your help!
You're welcome! It was my pleasure...
TALK ABOUT THE BROKEN STATUE
George, what happened here?
Jeanne has turned into a wild tigress! She was divinely beautiful in her rage, like Alecto or Tisiphone...
But she destroyed the statue, and now my life is over... She screamed something about love for one's country, for one's work... I don't know what's going on, Hector.
The potion you mentioned should have set her heart on fire, flaming with love for me, not the state!
I didn't know what would happen either, George.
Ah, well... This must be my fate. Love runs away from those who chase her, and throws herself on the necks of those who run away.
Now Jeanne, the light of my eyes, my muse, will leave me and this cheerless grey abode...
That's why I'm drinking, even though I see no truth in wine... Yet I'd encounter my end with a contemptuous smile and a glass in my hand!
TALK ABOUT JEANNE
What happened between you two?
She said I'm a worthless, miserable citizen of this great nation, and carried on about her love for her country, and for her work... I didn't understand any of it, Hector.
She left while saying she won't be back.
I'm very sorry, George.
I have no reason to stay here anymore. I have money but no muse, and therefore no inspiration. Love fades as we part...
I think I'll have to go away soon, Hector. I don't care where, I just need to get away from the place where everything reminds me of her!
How often we regret what we once wished for...
TALK ABOUT THE MISTRESS
Who's that woman who's visiting you?
You saw her? Of course you did! Who wouldn't notice a goddess like her?
She's my beautiful model, Jeanne Oehrn! This enchantress has stolen my heart, Hector.
All of my thoughts are focused on her... Although she hasn't warmed up to me yet, each obstacle makes my love that much stronger!
FIND OUT WHAT HE WANTS
What is it, George?
Like a wild beast, I can't tame my troubled thoughts about the miserable fortune we all face...
Could you just tell me about your problem in plain English?
Do you know what unrequited love is, Hector?
I know what it's like to lose a beloved wife, George. I believe that's more than enough to allow me to understand you.
Jeanne doesn't love me, and I want - more than anything else in the world - her to love me as passionately as I do her!
I'll stop at nothing to achieve my goal. I'm desperate, to the point of being willing to try a love potion!
If such a potion worked, would it not be a deceit? Would your conscience not smite you?
Find a way to make Jeanne fall in love with me, Hector! I'll give up everything for her love: my honor, my soul - even my conscience!
I don't think I can help you. But you never know... I'll ask around.
Thank you!
ASK FOR AN IMAGE OF A NUDE GIRL
George, I have an unusual request. You're an artist, and, well...
Do you by change have a picture of a naked girl?
Hector! What do you need it at your age? Do you believe, as a poet put it, that "Everything in love is true, but lust always lies?"
George, I swear, it's not for me.
Then why do you need it? Do you have an order from the Ministry?
CONVINCE (-300 points of authority)
Stop it, George. A young person simply wants to decorate his photo album...
Well, the young ones do tend to be hasty and chase naked naiads...
I have plenty of nudes! Take whichever one you want, Hector.
Stop hindering my work, Hector. I have nothing to do with such things!
END THE CONVERSATION
COLOR THE STUFFED BIRD
Hi George, I need your help.
Anything you want, my friend. I need a break from spoiling paper with pointless, soulless slogans...
Can you paint this stuffed bird so that it resembles a parrot?
What frivolous work! This is great, Hector! This is exactly what I need to blow away the cobwebs!
I can turn any piece of trash into a work of art.
Well, well...
One more stroke...
A little light in the eyes...
A couple more strokes here and...done! Here's your bird of happiness! I've never seen a live parrot, but I hope they look like this.
Thank you, George! You've been a big help. Excellent work!
Do you want something?
Bed bugs have infested my apartment! This is unacceptable! Instead of creating art I'm spending my time scratching myself!
With the exception of this giving my brush strokes a unique, unrestrained flair, it's unbearable!
As if the government sucking the life blood out of me every day wasn't enough, I now have to contend with these tiny parasites as well!
Do something, Hector, please!
I'm working on it.
TALK ABOUT THE BEDBUGS
Have you taken any steps toward removing those small bloodsuckers from my life?
YES
Soon, those buggers will be over and done with.
Thank God. My creative process is drained of blood - no pun intended.
NO
No, but I'll resolve this issue soon.
You'd better hurry, or you'll lose your tenants.
TALK ABOUT ZLATA GETTING HIT BY A CAR
George, did you hear about Zlata Schimmer being hit by a car? What a tragedy!
Life is full of tragedies, my friend... There is no light without darkness, no heat without cold...
I'll probably paint a picture like this: "The lament of a desolate mother and the implacable wheels of doom."
TALK ABOUT DONATING BLOOD
George, have you heard that everyone is required to donate blood?
My blood is seething with love and hate! Mind you, those are the ingredients for war...
My blood onto the ground will be shed!
The battlefield will soak it up to give...
Another chance for it to thrive...
May turn it into trees or blossoms that...
Um, I'm stuck there. Of course, I'll donate blood, Hector!
I believe, you're romanticizing the war beyond measure.
As a creative individual, I can't do anything about my proclivities. Verse is simply born out of any situation, as if it has a life of its own.
TALK ABOUT JEANNE'S ARREST
George, was Jeanne arrested?
That's it for me! I cannot live without my beloved Muse!
I cannot live without her... No wine can dull this pain!
I have to run away!
What do you mean "run?" Where to and what from?
Anywhere! From myself! From the unbearable agony! Ah, if only I could sacrifice myself to purchase her freedom!
TALK ABOUT EUTHANASIA
Have you heard about the Blissful Sleep procedure?
We're all asleep already, Hector.
Does it matter if we wake up sooner or later?
Are you drunk?
Yes, but can anyone stay sober while in the thick of the nightmare that is this life?
My heart is frozen... A sword is poised above my neck...
What am I saying? Who's listening?
SELL THE CHEMICAL (-500 reputation points)
Let's resort to local measures. I have that amazing spray for only $500!
Oh, it's all about the money again… Here, take those despised pieces of paper!
Hector, I could've never imagined you stepping as low as selling detergents…
I'm disappointed!
What's left is to find a connoisseur who could appreciate my masterpiece. Are there any gourmands of contemporary art?
In the Ministry, perhaps?
I'll think about what I can do. Your statue is really unique.
SAY HELLO
Allow me to introduce myself! My name is Hector Medina. I'm the new building manager.
My name is Khan van Megeren.
I'm an alternative medicine professional and an honored health care worker in our great nation.
I'm here to attend the medical academic conference. I'll be sharing my experiences and expertise.
It's great to finally have a doctor as a tenant!
My services are by no means cheap. I do only photo diagnosing for free.
Is that possible?
Nothing is impossible for a man like me. I've spent many years opening chakras and developing the mind's eye!
ASK ABOUT ALTERNATIVE MEDICINE
Pardon my ignorance, but what is alternative medicine?
Alternative medicine is health care at its most advanced! Traditional doctors and their medicines have misled our people for decades.
Medicines like aspirin and antibiotics don't help people, they harm them!
But antibiotics save lives! They're the only remedy for infection when the body can't heal itself.
You see? You're a victim of the propaganda! All those so-called drugs only interfere with the human biofield and hinder our connection to the universe!
Alternative medicine is based on the theory that there's no need to treat the body; you only have to release its internal reserves!
Our world contains endless sources of energy; you just need to learn how to tap into to them!
So, how do you open these reserves when a patient is seriously ill?
It's simple! I have dozens of exclusive ointments and balms which are guaranteed to restore anyone to health!
But they should only be used if fasting and urine therapy don't help.
What? Did you say "urine therapy?"
Why are you surprised? The human body contains everything it needs in order to health itself!
I can see the people in our country accepting the idea of curative fasting, but drinking urine? Are you serious?
The problem is you are stuck in your outdated understanding of medicine.
Why, you probably think vaccinations are a good idea!
What's wrong with vaccinations? How else can we prevent diseases?
Certainly not by inoculating healthy people with malignant bacteria! It's barbaric!
Thankfully, due to the shortage of antibiotics in this country, more and more citizens are turning to alternative methods of healing.
TALK ABOUT THE DIFFERENT REMEDIES
Hello, Khan! I, um, need your help.
Ah ha! Have you finally decided to explore the wonders of alternative medicine? I have remedies for every occasion!
All of them are charged with the positive energy of earth, air, water and fire, as evidenced in my certificates.
CALEFACIENT
Here's the problem: an old woman who lives here is always cold. She can't warm up or stop getting sick, and it's been a long time since we've had access to a mustard plaster.
Can you do anything for her?
Of course! I have a wonderful balm called Merry Dracaris. It warms up the joints and drives blood throughout the body!
It costs $500.
BUY
Here's the money!
And here's the jar.
I'll come back with the money.
END THE DIALOG
REMEDY AGAINST FEAR
Do you have anything that helps one to overcome fear? Some sort of sedative, perhaps?
Yes, I have something that might help. It's very strong, and I haven't tested it yet, but have no fear!
If you are afraid to drink it, just drink it! Hahaha! It's nothing complicated! A bit of amphetamine, a drop of ephedrine, motherwort extract and formalin with butyrate.
I gave it a truly poetic name: "Face Your Monsters." Do you like it? You must admit that it's quite special!
Here's the phial.
A REMEDY FOR AMPUTEES
A man, Murray Gibbs, lives in our building. Years ago, he was wounded in battle and lost his leg. To this day, he still feels pain in his limb, even though it's no longer there.
Perhaps you have a drug that can alleviate his pain. He's a war veteran, and deserves to be helped.
I just finished working on a delightful remedy called "Leg Grow!"
It's very potent but he won't regret taking it! The results are stunning! He'll grow a new leg in under a minute!
What do you mean by "grow?"
I mean grow! This concoction releases the latent potential of the body to self-recover!
There's an extra set of limbs inside everyone, and you can make them grow.
Do you want it? It costs $500.
A POTION TO IMPROVE ONE'S MENTAL PROWESS
One of our neighbors, Johanne Bessler, is suffering from mental fatigue. Do you have anything that can increase the supply of blood to his brain?
Look no further! Horse nostril extract mixed with a squeeze of boar prostate is excellent for stimulating the mental processes!
It's called "Killer Descartes!" Johanne will have so many brilliant ideas, he won't be able to keep up with his own brain.
Tell him to dilute three drops in 50 liters of water and drink it in the morning.
A CURE FOR SORROW
One of our tenants misses his late wife. Do you know of anything other than alcohol that can help one to overcome such deep sorrow?
Hmmm... I can offer him an experimental potion called "Blast from the Past."
How does it work?
I don't know if it works or not; I haven't tested it yet.
By theory, the patient's memories may appear to materialize.
This should help him to cope with his painful memories and say goodbye to his loved one...
Are you talking about hallucinations?
What are memories but an illusion, a construct of our mind? Do you want it or not?
PICK UP THE CONVERSATION LATER
Honestly, I don't know what I need.
Come back when you know. I have everything!
TALK ABOUT DONATING BLOOD
What do you think about the general populace being required to donate blood?
It's a wicked practice. What if they bedevil you? I never even throw away my hair or nail clippings. I keep them at home.
Professor Louser issued a report recently about the devastating effect of donkey dung on the human body.
If you soak it in human blood, the blood will become diseased, even if you're a hundred miles away from someone!
How can I entrust my blood to anyone? Nobody knows, after all, what they'll do with it later!
However, everyone is required to donate.
I should have prepared an invisibility balm a long time ago to hide from the authorities when they come to enforce these orders!

By the way, your receding hairline attracts too much attention. Do you want to buy a hair growth paste for your head? Hair might also grow on your back, but I have a hair remover as well. I'll sell you both bottles at a discount!
No thanks. I'm fine with the amount of hair on my head.
Your loss. They say a bald head is a sign of a restless soul.
ASK ABOUT A LOVE POTION
Could you help me with something? I have a friend who's hopelessly in love with someone...
I don't believe in love potions, but he's desperate and willing to resort to any method...
Hmmm... I could come up with something... But I'll need a favor in return!
What do you want?
My research on neurolinguistic programming and aromatherapy symbiosis is quite expensive.
I'd like to you to help me make the money I need.
I have a box of my patented anti-itch tinctures, but I can't sell them to people who are feeling fine. I need to create, ummm, a market for them...
How are we supposed to do that?
I have an old blanket full of bedbugs from my last residence. I cut it up and put the pieces into plastic bags...
You place one bag under each bed in your building, and when your tenants start to complain, I'll sell them my tincture!
Are you crazy? That would be a horrible thing to do, not to mention illegal!
Come on! De jure, it would be nothing more than a petty offense.
A petty offense?
Yes, and I'll pay you handsomely for helping me pull this off: $3,000!
After I sell my tinctures, you can call the exterminators and arrange to have the apartments disinsected. Is it a deal?
AGREE
I can't believe I'm agreeing to this. Give me your bags.
Relax! Nothing bad will happen!
REFUSE
No! I won't unleash a bed bug epidemic in my building!
OK. That's your choice! But don't expect me to help you anymore!
TALK ABOUT THE BAGS
I fulfilled your request. The bed bug bags are in place. Now, it's time for you to make good on your end of the bargain.
Thank you! You did me a solid! I'm going to sell every last one of my tinctures! Here's your money.
Thank you! Now, what about your help with the love potion?
Bring me a personal item of the victim.
Victim?
I mean patient! I need something personal to make the potion work.
TALK ABOUT THE LOVE POTION
I BROUGHT YOU A PERSONAL ITEM (A PURSE)
I BROUGHT YOU A PERSONAL ITEM (A HAT)
I brought you what you asked for. This hat belongs to Jeanne.
Excellent choice; it'll work well. Wait here for a bit.
Done! Give this potion to your victim... I mean to Jeanne! Make sure she drinks it.
I guarantee she'll fall head over heels in love with the person she works for.
I brought you what you asked for. This purse belongs to Jeanne.
ASK ABOUT THE PARROT
I have a strange request. Do you by chance have a parrot - either alive or stuffed?
Believe it or not, that's not the strangest request I've heard.
I don't have a parrot, but I do have a stuffed crow! It'll work even better than a parrot! You won't have to feed it, it won't shit everywhere and it can't fly away. It'll be an excellent investment!
BUY A STUFFED CROW ($1,000)
Okay, give me your stuffed crow. I'll see what I can do with it.
Great! Would you also be interested in a stuffed cat? I've got one in mind. It lives nearby, and it would make a great addition to the décor of any home!
Pay me first and then you'll get what you need. That's the only way I do business!
ASK ABOUT KHAN'S WORK
Tell me about your work, Khan.
I've devoted my life to healing people and studying the miraculous laws of our world...
Both the obvious and the hidden ones. The stupids believe that the laws of physics and chemistry rule this world. What feeble minds!
So what rules this world?
Secret forces and mystical energies! And Master Talapoin, of course!
What kind of miraculous laws? And who?!
The higher a person's consciousness ascends, the more his or her life improves! It's possible to advance one's level of consciousness in just a few months.
We even have an official club with membership fees and ID cards.
Talapoin is the ruler of the Galactic Empire. He introduced the universal laws millions of years ago. These laws are still in operation today on our world!
I see... I've heard of one of such law...
