It's called the Law of the Transformation of Human Stupidity into Bank Notes. Have you heard of it?
I like your sense of humor, Hector.
So you don't have a proper job?
You're predictable, Hector. Countless people have meaningless jobs. Why must I be a sheep, falling in line with the herd?
TALK ABOUT EUTHANASIA
Have you heard about the Blissful Sleep procedure?
What a sick procedure! It's such an inhuman solution to the challenge of old age!
Elderly people could take part in experiments!
Just imagine the resources that are wasted and the discoveries we could make! Just think of all the potions they could test!
ASK WHAT HE NEEDS
Do you want something?
What the hell, Hector? You brought me a bed bug bag, too? My bed is full of tiny bloodsuckers!
So use your tincture!
That's not funny! I'm not going to waste my products on myself! Do something, Hector! Call the exterminators at once!
TALK ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF LEG GROW
A potion of yours has killed a man!
That can't be true! My potions are 100 percent safe - assuming you follow the instructions...
What instructions?!
The instructions on the bottle. If this person had read them, he would have known the potion should be consumed only under a full moon...
...while lying down with one's head pointed north! It's not my fault he didn't take what the label says seriously!
TALK ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF FACE THE MONSTERS
It wasn't the potion that killed him, it was his own fear!
But the potion was supposed to help him overcome his fear!
Sometimes, even alternative medicine can't help someone.
Stop it, Hector. He would have died anyway, with or without the remedy. We have only lanced a deadly abscess on his soul.
You goddamn quack!
You're lucky that Saturn is in the Seventh House today. My astrologer says I can brush off any insult.
TALK ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF MERRY DRACARIS
The warming potion you gave me nearly burned Rosa Ranek!
But that's what I said it would do, right? It's warming and stimulating, making her as good as new!
TALK ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF BLAST FROM THE PAST
The potion didn't killed him, guilt did. See the warnings listed on the label!
"Do not use if you have strong feelings of guilt and your lifeline crosses your fate line on your left hand."
It's not my fault when victims - I mean patients - ignore the instructions!
TALK ABOUT THE EFFECTS OF KILLER DESCARTES
I told you what the dosage should be: three drops diluted in 50 liters of water! I'm not responsible for those who ignore my instructions!
How can you be so calm? Johanne exploded!
Johanne Bessler became Johanne Burns!
Is that supposed to be a joke? A man died, you heartless quack!
Homeopathy has not been fully studied yet, Hector. I guess for further use, the dosage should be reduced to one drop per 200 liters of water.
You've already bought 3 balsams from me. Would you like to try something special yourself?
Like what? To be honest, I'm deeply attached to whatever is left of my life.
Oh, I have a special offer for you. Since the first day, I couldn't help but admire your cat.
What an original name! You have a good taste, Hector.
Your cat is steady and solid… as if it were part of our state apparatus.
And his screams are impossible to ignore…
That's true, screams like he's starving to death. But I know for sure he gets fed, and then also gets snacks from every tenant…
Would you like to know, what exactly is your cat screaming about? His dreams, his desires?
What do you mean?
I got a recipe for a potion that helps you understand animal speech.
I added Valerian root and powdered mouse bones, so it'll be easy to get your buddy's attention.
It will cost next to nothing, mere $1000. For the trouble of catching mice and processing…
Sounds great. I'll buy it!
I knew it!
Drink at once, Hector! I must see this historical moment!
I tried a weaker version of the potion myself, but mice aren't that great at small talk. You wouldn't imagine the nonsense they were saying.
At least, now I know Mark Ranek keeps a can of roe in his apartment, and Rosa's leather shoes are delicious.
Unfortunately, I don't have enough on me. I'll stop by later.
REFUSE
No, no way, this is impossible, I don't believe that stuff.
Nonsense! Everything is possible; your scientists would've eaten their pants, if they only knew!
BUY POTION
I'm ready to buy your potion!
Hector! I heard tenants complaining of bed bugs. I have a great spray against them! Trust me, bugs will be gone in a jiffy!
Only $1000 for 5, best price in town!
OK, I'll take it.
Money first!
I'd rather say no. That's suspicious: first the bugs, now you…
You're missing out.
I need your help, Hector!
I'm on the verge of something great.
Did you find a way to cure some horrible disease?
In a way, yes, I suppose. And do you know what's in my way?
What?
A stack of mice!
Mice? Are you insane, van Megeren? I have no time for jokes.
I'm deadly serious. I need a stack of best field mice.
I tried using white lab mice and regular rats, but that didn't work. I need field mice.
What do you want of me?
I saw your cat carrying one of those, and allowed myself to take it from him. That's exactly what I need!
I'm sure you could pick up the mice your Order catches, and bring to me.
But he eats them!
If you feed your cat properly, Hector, he won't eat mice. He'd just bring them home, as prey, that's the hunting instinct.
GIVE MICE
I brought you mice. There, go ahead, towards your "something great"…
Come here, my pretties! So fat, so cute!
Thank you endlessly, Hector, you and your precious Order!
DISCUSS THE ANIMAL TALK POTION
That potion you gave me… It works!
Huh! Of course it does!
Do you have more?
No, Hector, I only made one portion and do not intend to repeat. I am preoccupied with more urgent matters.
If you have mice, bring them to me and I'll pay $250 per tail.
SELL MICE
I didn't come to you empty-handed…
Excellent! Here's your money.
Oh, it's a wholesale batch! Wonderful!
Enough for now, Hector.
SAY HELLO
Allow me to introduce myself. My name is Hector Medina. I'm the manager of this building.
My name is Jeanne Oehrn.
Do you know George de Latour?
Yes. I sometimes model for him. For some reason, he thinks I'm his muse.
You do inspire him.
I find those kinds of compliments strange. I'm not used to hearing things like that.
Still, I'm glad for the opportunity to earn some money, and George is a gentleman. He hasn't made any untoward advances or asked me to do anything indecent.
TALK ABOUT HER LIFE
Tell me about yourself,
Why are you interested in me?
PERSUADE HER (-500 reputation points)
I'm supposed to know everything about the people who live in my building. It's my job.
Fine. I was married once, but it didn't work out.
Why?
I was a good girl, he was a bad guy. I fell in love like a fool. We were such a cliché!
It wasn't anything like in the movies. He refused to settle down. All of my attempts to create a family environment for us angered him.
Besides, my ex-husband was involved in illegal cock fighting, while I happened to be a well-bred lady. That was a deal breaker.
Once we were divorced, I realized I was financially dependent on my husband.
Is this why you work as a model?
Yes. I have to earn my own living. It's not so bad. George is a kind man.
I do think he's in love with me. That makes me feel sorry for him...
You feel sorry for him? Isn't being loved a wonderful thing?
Yes, but only when it’s mutual. I'll never be able to love someone again.
Poor George...
Excuse me, but my life is none of your business.
LEAVE HER ALONE
I express an interest in all of my tenants. I'm sorry; I didn't mean to upset you.
My life is a private matter.
TALK ABOUT GEORGE DE LATOUR
What do you think about George?
He's a nice man. He has good manners and pays me well. He lets me stay in his apartment without asking for anything in return.
It's a good way to save on rent.
What do you think of him as a person?
Honestly? He reminds me of a sad poodle.
A poodle?
You know, the cute and fluffy kind with sad eyes. The kind that's fun to cuddle and care for.
But no girl would want to be in a relationship with a poodle.
That sounds unnatural...
That's right!
TRY TO ACQUIRE A PERSONAL ITEM
Good afternoon, Jeanne. How are you? Are you still staying at George's?
I'm fine, thanks, and yes, I'm still living in your building. Do you want something, Hector?
Yes... I mean no... I mean... Never mind! I was just thinking about adding more flowers to the hallway. Do you think the tenants would like that?
If I were to place them here, in the corner, for example...
(Jeanne turns away)
TAKE THE PURSE FROM HER POCKET
(Hector snatches Jeanne's purse and quickly hides it behind his back.)
I don't know, Hector... Flowers aren't my thing. It's up to you.
DO NOTHING
PERSUADE HER TO DRINK THE LOVE POTION
I have an offer you can't refuse, Jeanne!
What would that be?
I want to treat you to this invigorating and health-boosting balsam.
No thank you, Hector. I don't accept drinks from people I barely know.
Besides, you offering me this is a little weird...
PERSUADE HER (-500 reputation points)
Think again before you refuse. You have an entire day of work ahead of you. An energy boost could be just the thing to get you through it.
It's also been known to improve one's complexion. So what do you think? I have just have just one bottle of this stuff left.
All one has to do around here to improve one's complexion is wash the coal dust off one's face.
Then again, you never can tell what might happen... Give me your balsam!
What kind of crap are you trying to give me? I'm not going to drink that!
END THE DIALOG
TALK ABOUT ART
Modern art is a strange thing. It's supposed to be for the public, but the public doesn't understand it...
One of the shop owners I know sells more still-lifes than anything else.
You know, the appetizing ones with lots of delicious food: crusty meat and bread, slabs of Swiss cheese with huge holes...
Which isn't surprising, as that sort of food long ago disappeared from our tables.
That's it! What's the point of art if the people are hungry?
TALK ABOUT DONATING BLOOD
Have you heard about the blood donation initiative?
You mean the deception the Ministry is using to hunt down those who have allegedly betrayed the motherland? Yes, I've heard about that. But I have nothing to fear.
I can catch any traitor!
I broke up with him! How could I have been so blind? He's a saboteur!
Did you see that disgusting statue he made?
You broke up with him?
It's like scales fell off my eyes and I was able to see him for who he really is! He calls himself an artist! Ha! He's just a talentless hack who's wasting his time on trifles.
Only smokers are more disgusting. They ruin their health instead of preserving it so they can serve their motherland!
I understand now that all men are brutes and misogynists!
What are you talking about?!
I used to think I'd ever love again! Then all of a sudden, it dawned on me! You must love yourself and your country, not some primate who calls himself a man!
I'm going to do everything I can to ensure that the voices of the forgotten women of this country are heard! Tomorrow, I'm going to apply for a job at the manufacturing plant!
I will strive for equal rights and respect for every woman!
It seems the balsam affected you differently than I was expecting.
What are you mumbling about? Can't you speak clearly? I guess that's just one more thing that proves women are superior to men!
A woman must be in control of all of her faculties!
TALK ABOUT THE STATE OF THE COUNTRY
Have you heard about the Wise Leader, who freed the musicians who stayed abroad for an extra day?
Of course! Now everyone is talking about how kind and merciful he is.
Has everyone forgotten about the imprisonment of the athletes who failed to bring home gold medals from the games?
He shouldn't have done that. He should have imprisoned the traitors instead!
My heart bleeds when I think about people who spend their lives trying to produce sounds from different objects.
I would have given them axes and saws instead of musical instruments! Those lazy bums would be more useful if they were harvesting lumber.
What? Can't you see we're busy?
Stop interfering with our work, sir.
Unless you'd like a face full of gas and a chance to bid this world goodbye...
MEET
Hello. My name is Hector. I'm the manager of this apartment building - for now...
Good afternoon, comrade Hector! Murray Gibbs, staff sergeant, infantry regiment 10, reporting! I was honorably discharged due to the loss of an extremity! at the Southern front.
I have been temporarily allocated here!
It's nice to meet you, Staff Sergeant Gibbs!
ASK ABOUT WORK
Do you work in the canteen?
Yup! I'm assigned to the campus to which General Airel Johnson is coming.
I've been with the field kitchen ever since the war started. It's an honor to be back on duty!
I'm cooking for the draftees. It's like feeding cattle!
What did you do before that?
I was retired. I'm expecting to get an apartment and a raise in my pension any day now.
Any day! What a great country this is. Some nations don't honor the people who are ready to die for it!
ASK ABOUT THE WAR
What it's like to be at war? Scary?
Scary doesn't begin to describe it. There's nothing worse! Except maybe coming home drunk and with lipstick on your face on your wedding anniversary.
That's pretty much why I signed up - to escape my spouse's wrath.
You're married?
Not anymore. She's with someone else. Has been for a long time. I'm married to the battlefield, although even she has become something of an ex-spouse...
Do you miss war?
Well, there's one thing I don't miss: the aftertaste of blast charges in my porridge. Ha ha ha! Civilians eat much better.
ASK ABOUT HIS INJURY
What happened to your leg?
Like I told you, I was working for the field kitchen. It was winter, and conditions were harsh. Our enemy surrounded us and cut off our supply chain.
My comrades were dying of cold and starvation. There was no food! We were so hungry, we dug through the snow in the ravines and harvested frozen grass...
After a week of nettle-weed soup, I became desperate and... Well... To make a long story short, we had enough stew for a week! And we survived!
Unbelievable! You made soup out of your leg?!
Every soldier must do his duty. My duty was to feed my comrades.
I received a medal for that.
What a stunning story!
We were storming an important hill. The enemy had secured every point of access with barbed wire, moats and land mines...
At the top of the hill, the soldiers in a concrete pillbox were mowing down our troops like grass.
I was charged with sneaking in at night and planting a bomb. It wasn't easy, and it was dangerous, but I made it. I immediately secured the backpack with the explosive...
...and just as I turned on the timer, an enemy soldier appeared!
Oh, no!
Oh, yes! I was scared shitless. He immediately tried to stab me. The whole place was going to be blown to smithereens in about a minute, but we just stayed there, fighting.
The next thing I knew, there was a deafening BOOM... I couldn't hear anything for a month. We were thrown aside, still fighting.
In the heat of the battle, I grabbed something next to me - I thought it was a stick or a log - and kept hitting him with it until he went quiet.
Oh, my! Was it...
Yes. It was my leg! The guys wouldn't stop teasing me about it! They said I kicked one right through middle of the uprights that night...
I even earned a medal for that... I'd rather have a new leg, but a medal is better than nothing.
Actually, that's a really silly story. What actually happened was we were crossing the river and took a break. I took my boots off and saw my leg had turned black!
So, they sent me to the hospital and amputated it immediately to prevent blood-poisoning.
What sucks is that my leg had turned black because the dye in my uniform ran when I stepped into the river.
That's horrible!
It was! Half the unit lost their legs before they figured out what happened!
We all received medals, of course. Useless, but shiny, medals.
That's an incredible story! They were going to plant me behind enemy lines as a signal officer.
That would've given us access to the most current data and made us aware of the enemy's every move.
Our senior officers had a picture of the enemy officer and chose me because of my resemblance to him.
There was only one issue: the photo revealed that he had only one leg. So I had to sacrifice it for the Motherland.
They trained me for the mission for two years! The plan was simple: once we were there, the other men were going to grab him and I was going to take his place.
That was brave of you!
Yeah, but our efforts turned out to be for nothing. Once we were there, we saw he had both legs!
He was just fooling around in that photograph, pretending to be missing a limb.
That's horrible!
Tell me about it. Anyhow, while they were trying to decide what to do next, I served as a cook.
Then I received a medal and was honorably discharged.
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
Hello, Murray. What do you want?
I'm not sure you can help me. Even the doctors have lost all hope. At least you won't make it worse...
Try me.
My leg hurts like hell at night. Funny, huh? I don't have a leg, yet it hurts.
Doctors call those phantom pains, and all I can do is wait until it's gone. But it's been several years already, and nothing's changed.
As for our drugstores, simple necessities like iodine and bandages are hard to find, so forget about locating painkillers...
If only you could get me something to easy my constant, excruciating pain... I'd be very grateful!
I'll see what I can do.
OFFER MURRAY LEG GROW
Murray! I have just the thing for you! They say it'll help your leg!
Really? You're my savior, Hector! Hand it over!
There you go.
It looks weird. You definitely didn't get this from a drugstore... But whatever! It's not like things could get any worse, right?
Thank you, Hector!
ASK WHAT HAPPENED
Murray, you look tired. What's up?
I don't know what to do. I've been a soldier all my life; it's all I know. When I was discharged, it hurt more than losing my leg.
The only thing giving me a purpose in this world was my work at the canteen.
That was the only place I could still feel alive. I could talk with fellow soldiers, listen to their stories...
What happened to you?
I just found out I'm not getting an apartment or a pension. After Johnson arrives, they'll write me off and take away my work permit.
I was betrayed! I don't get it; why did they throw me out? It was different at war. It was kill or be killed, and your fellow soldiers were your family...
I have no one here. On the battlefield, I drove a tank; they trusted me with equipment worth millions of dollars! Well, between meals, of course.
Can I help you find a job?
I doubt you'd find anything for this old veteran, but feel free, Hector.
TELL MURRAY ABOUT THE JOB
Good news, Murray. I saw an ad in the newspaper. Have you ever considered performing on stage?
You want me to become an actor? Are you kidding me? I wouldn't stand a chance. Why would they want someone with just one leg?
That's your advantage! They need someone to play a pirate, and who could be better than a one-legged veteran who's seen the best and worst life has to offer?
I suppose no one... Okay, I'll give it a try.
How did the audition go?
Not well. A whole mess of one-legged people show up. You're not the only smart person around, Hector.
I don't know what else we could do. Everyone's looking for a pirate costume; some folks are even considering removing an eye so they'll be given an eye patch.
In other words, everyone's trying to stand out. I think the main pirate props are a bottle of rum and a parrot!
But the stage is an alcohol-free zone, and I have no idea where I could get a parrot...
A parrot, huh? I'll see what I can do.
I'll let you know if something pops up.
DISCUSS THE PARROT
I found a parrot for you! A real one! Here! Now you're a shoo-in for the role!
Thank you, Hector! You've gone beyond the call of duty for me. You would have made a great soldier.
Murray, I brought you a stuffed bird.
A parrot?
Not quite... It's a crow.
What good will that do me? It doesn't look like a parrot. However, if its feathers were colored...
Colored feathers? I think I can help...
Murray, I brought you a painted stuffed crow that looks just like a parrot. See?
Hmmm... I guess that's better than nothing. Thanks!
Blow up the audience, Murray!
For Pete's sake, Hector, I don't have any explosives, and I don't intend to blow up anyone!
Besides, I should try to make it through the auditions first...
I messed up that phrase, Murray. What I meant to say was: I hope you get the part and become really popular!
Great news, Hector! I landed the part! The opening night is coming up. It'll be amazing! I haven't been this happy in ages!
Please come see the play in a month or so. I'll get you a free pass!
That's great news! But I'm afraid I won't be able to make it to the play. In a month, I'll probably be gone.
But I'm glad I was able to help you.
I'm sad to hear that.
In that case, here. It's my health permit. It's all I have to give to you.
Perhaps you or someone else could use it. I know how hard it is to get papers nowadays.
Who knows? It could save someone's life.
Thank you, Murray! Good luck on the road to celebrity!
DISCUSS THE HEALTH PERMIT
How are you doing, Murray? I have a question for you.
Shoot...
You said you worked in the canteen. Does that mean you have a health permit? I need to know for my report.
Of course. It's the only way I could work in the canteen.
LIE AND TAKE THE BOOK (-1,000 reputation points)
I need to copy it for the Ministry.
Hmmm... That's a first... Well, you're the manager, so I guess you know what you're doing. Here you go.
Make sure to give it back! This job is all I have left.
I don't believe you, Hector. There's no way I'm going to give my health permit to you.
END CONVERSATION
Hector! Where's my health permit? You said you were only borrowing it. Give it back to me!
What health permit? I don't recall borrowing anything from you...
What? You rear-echelon motherf… I'm going to issue a complaint with the Board for Veterans!
Stop yelling! You're not in the army anymore. Besides, if you continue to behave like this, the police will drag you away.
Burn in hell, administrative rat!
Hello, Murray.
Screw you, weasel!
Hi, Hector.
PROVIDE THE DNA SAMPLES
I'm here to give you the DNA samples.
You're very slow, Hector. You know our work can't wait!
I'm sorry. This won't happen again.
Did you bring the samples?
YES, SORTED BY NAME
Thank you for your service. Take care.
NOT YET
Do you think I love standing here? Do you think I have nothing better to do?
DISCUSS ZLATA'S SAMPLE
Here you go. It's urgent! Can you process this one next?
Comrade Hector! Directive number 321458 prohibits altering the data processing order. I could be executed for breaking that rule! Or, worse, I could be fired!
Please! It's important; a child's life depends on it. I'll do anything!
Anything, huh? Hmmm... I need a rare item. It's currently banned.
I believe there's an artist living in your building. Order him to paint a naked woman...
I need this for my, um, personal research on human anatomy!
Uh, are you sure you wouldn't rather just bribe me?
I could report you for that!
OK, I'll try.
Here's the sample. I suspect that's the girl that went missing.
What's this? A bone? That's awful! Did you find it in your building?
Yes. I hope you'll process it next.
I know the procedures. We'll be in touch.
Did you bring me a sample? I don't have much time.
Not yet.
GIVE HIM THE PAINTING
I have what you want.
Careful! Someone could see us! Give me the sample.
So, will you process it next?
Sure. You'll have the results within a day.
Where's the sample? If you don't bring something suitable for DNA analysis, I won't be able to help you.
END CONVERSATION
I'm waiting for you to bring me the stuff I need.
GIVE ZLATA'S DNA
For how much longer do I have to wait?
I brought you a sample.
Just a little bit longer!
PROVIDE THE CANNED GOODS
Are you hungry, fuzz ball? Here's your food!
*meow*
Hungry, fuzzball? There is no more cat food.
FEED THE CAT THE RED CAVIAR
Look what I have for you! Banned goods!
You won't tell on me, will you, kitty?
PET THE CAT
Come here, kitty. I've had a rough day, too...
Though I didn't spend my day on my side, scratching the chair. Obviously, you've been much busier than me.
TALK
Sucks to be you, buddy.
So is mine.
Stop whining and feed me!
What?
Feed me!
You're panicking instead of looking for solutions.
All of you humans are like that. So are mice.
Every problem has multiple solutions.
Order! You can talk?
No, you can listen and respond now. Did that nice person teach you? You smell like his herbs and mice.
I can't believe it! It worked!
Is that all you want to discuss?
I… I don't know, you're my buddy, I often talk to you.
You're a good man, Hector.
You saved me that winter, warmed me up and took into your home. I want to thank you.
You, people, like money. That's so weird. Cats couldn't care less. But I can find it, though, cause I can smell it.
But, Order, I don't want to take someone's money!
Listen, while you still can.
There is a cache in the house foundation, on the right, behind the rock. I hear rats squabbling there, this is painful…
I can hear them, but not get them. And it smells like money.
I don't know what to say, Order…
Say nothing. Words are cheap and don't matter.
What does?
What matters the most, Hector, is… meow!
Order?
Meoooowww!
Say something!
MEET
I'm Hector Medina, the manager of the apartment block.
I'm Johanne Bessler, an inventor.
Trying to make our world a bit more convenient. I've already applied for 153 patents in the last 10 years!
How many of them did you get?
4 so far. But I'm only starting my journey to become the greatest inventor of our time!
DISCUSS WORK
What do you do for living?
Ever since I can remember, I'm always busy inventing and constructing. Take alarm clocks apart and assemble them back together, as my father used to say.
I applied for state funding. They choose one young inventor with potential, and pay for one of his projects.
The winner gets to go to the capital and work in the best construction labs.
I could never even dream of this!
I'm sure you'll succeed.
Alas, it's not up to me. All applicants are scrutinized.
There's several hundreds of them…
I heard they even review pedigree, to avoid a scandal, like they had three years ago.
What scandal?
They financed a guy, and he turned out to be a revolutionist. Came up with a propaganda speech when been live during the awards ceremony.

He managed to say a lot before he was tied up and carried away. Though I have no clue, what exactly he was saying, cause all the viewers had to sign the confidentiality agreement. They even did an exemplary execution.
Though, what really bothers me is that I'm running out of ideas. As if… me head refuses to work…
DISCUSS BRAIN POTION
I found a great potion for you, it's called 'Crazy Decart'.
Drink it in the morning, 3 drops per 15 gallons of water; that will bring your inspiration back.
Three drops per 15 gallons? Where am I expected to get that much water?
As an experienced manuals writer, I must let you know this is utter nonsense!
I will drink all of it at once; this won't hurt.
I'd rather not, if I were you. Experimental potion, they must've known what they were talking about in the manual…
There is no such thing as too many ideas, Hector!
DISCUSS FUNDING
I heard you couldn't get the funding. Sorry about that.
Sorry about what? Ruining my career?!
Don't you think they told me it was your speech that forever left me out of the engineering world?
I hate you!
DISCUSS THE EXPLOSION
What are you doing?!!
Just a failed experiment.
Such a lousy inventor can't go without making mistakes, right? Right, Hector, the Power Broker?
Consider yourself lucky it wasn't your apartment!
DISCUSS BED BUGS
What's up?
Bed bugs!
They're coming from the downstairs apartments! But I don't lose hope. I made a device that sucks them in!
A bed bug vacuum?
I call it Bugminator 3700.
That's the amount I had to pay in fines for testing my first invention.
I made a radio amplifier to listen to it outside during the annual clean-up.
Something went wrong, and the sound wave shattered all the windows… Ah, good old times…
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
I got the grant! Help me decide…
I came up with several inventions, and can't choose which one to proceed with.
Tell me about it.
PORTABLE PHONE
This will be epic! Calling right from the car! Our officials will love it!
According to my calculations, it will weigh about 130 lbs., but I already designed a cart!
A cart? What's next, an engine?
You're a genius, Hector! Why didn't I think of it?
Huh, they'll be able to ride a telephone booth!
Are you mocking me? I'm adamant that will be a real breakthrough!
AGREE
I'm sure it's a breakthrough! You will perfect your invention, and make it small enough to carry in a purse!
BACK TO OPTIONS
It's a tough decision. What are the other options?
TELEPORT
That's amazing. Picture it: going to work straight from home in no time!
Our people will be able to work more. Or, we could teleport our troops straight into the enemy capital and take over!
Wait a second. What if a criminal decides to steal from my office, or from the Ministry of Economy safe?
Why would someone do that? I'm positive all of our comrades are honest people. If they don't have to waste time commuting, they'll have more of it to ponder the meaning of life.
And other important matters. Everyone will be honest!
Oh, Johanne, you underestimate our people. I'm afraid half of the country will teleport to another planet…
And will live their old ways there! You can't run away from a problem, unless it's a pack of rabid dogs!
You're right about the pack… But it does sound like something new and useful.
Really?
Yes, I'm sure. You should choose this one.
SHAGOHOD WALKING CANNON
This will change warfare as we know it! Imagine a giant walking machine strolling through the battlefield, shooting giant cannons!
And in days of peace, they can carry loads. That will be awesome!
Load carriers won't side with you here.
Those wonderful people can learn some other great trade.
Well… That's pretty ambitious…
You think so?
Absolutely. You should proceed with this one!
CLEAREYE OPTI DEVICE
Most of the people I know hate going to the doctor. You know how it is.
I will revolutionize healthcare! I will create a system of monitors, analyzing the health status and compiling a report with recommendations.
Equipped with: helmet, wetsuit, wires and automated typewriter. The only thing people will have to do is add paper…
And how long does it take?
12 to 20 hours, nothing to talk about.
Eventually, I plan to add the stress measurement and prevention module.
Stress prevention? What do you mean?
Automassage and sedation. They can sleep while still in the suit!
What do you say?
Sounds nice, we could use private doctors…
DISCUSS BLOOD DONATION
Did you see the bloodmobile by the house?
Yes, what an awful vehicle. I bet you half of the blood turns unusable before they even make it to the hospital.
I should come up with an alternative. Flying bloodmobiles with cooling… shaped like a red drop… That's awesome!
DISCUSS WAR
What do you think of war?
I don't think, I'm busy inventing. Doing all I can to help the country.
Just finished designing a tank with all-round cannons. They will shoot in all directions at once!
And hit allies?
Hm, I haven't considered that possibility…
END CONVERSATION
MEET
I'm Hector Medina, the manager of the apartment block.
I'm Lionel Kramer.
I'm a writer, collecting data for my new book…
How many have you published already, Lionel?
This is my first one.
I see. Just sounded like you had books published before.
Don't see anything wrong with that. This book WILL be a new one.
DISCUSS THE SKELETON IN THE CLOSET
Lionel, why do you keep a skeleton in the closet?! Where did it come from?!
You know, Hector… This is my late wife, I loved her very much… So much, that couldn't part with her when she passed away.
I just couldn't bury her. I understand that looks crazy, but try to believe me…
Her presence comforts me…
How do I know you're not lying?
You don't. You either trust me, or report me. In any case, you'd think I'm insane.
So all I can do is pray for your mercy.
I have to think about it.
Hector… Since you know my secret now… And in case you decide to not report my… peculiarities…
Please, help me…
What do you want?
I'm not here for long. But leaving without my wife…
I need a big suitcase to transport her, and the one I had is ruined. Please, help me find one.
And I swear you'll never hear from me again.
AGREE
OK, I'll help you.
REFUSE
I can't help you. I'm still trying to digest what I just heard.
DISCUSS HIS WIFE
What happened to your wife? I've never seen anyone carrying around a… skeleton before.
It's a long story.
We were inseparable… One life, one love. But once I was away, and she died, and I can't forgive myself for leaving her.
I promised her I'll never leave her again. So, that's how it is now.
I wish I could talk to her spirit and beg for forgiveness. Oh, Gabriella…
Ehm, and how did you… well… got rid of… How did you get the bones clean? Sorry for asking.
Oh, regular acid, nothing special. I couldn't soil the whiteness of my beloved one's bones with rotting flesh...
I polish the bones every day.
Hate dirt.
DISCUSS PAST EXPLOSION BALM
I know how to make it easier for you. I have that balm, it allows you to meet the deceased.
Sounds weird. Is it hallucinogenic?
I was told that'll help to pacify your conscience, to have a closure.
Sounds interesting. I'd rather be alone doing so, though. If you don't mind.
DISCUSS SUITCASE
Lionel, I got you a suitcase. Hope it's big enough. And hope to never see you and your skeletons again!
Thank you, Hector, I promise you won't hear from me again… Well, hear about me - maybe.
What do you mean?
I meant my book, Hector. This way or another, but I'll be famous!
DISCUSS THE MURDER
Lionel! I know everything! It's you!
What are you talking about, Hector?
You are the white-gloved murderer! It's you the newspapers are talking about!
How could I believe that foolish wife story?! You abduct women and kill them!
What should I do to you now?!
No, no! Anything but that! You don't understand! I'm not killing them, I'm releasing them! Setting them free from that horrible world of suffering!
They suffer from the dirt around and within them… I'm freeing their souls!
I can't leave them be in this world. Please, don't tell on me! I'll give you all my money!
OK, hand it over and get lost.
Thank you, Hector, it's all I have!
Get out of my apartment block! Today!
Oh no, I won't let you go so easily. I wanted to know what your motives were. Now I see you're nothing but a monster, hiding behind illusions and lame excuses!
And now they'll get you, put you in a cage, leave there for a while to ponder, and then 'release' with 2700V.
You're wrong, Hector. I'm a nobody, the state couldn't care for me less.
So keep your threats to yourself. If you really had evidence, you would've already reported me.
DISCUSS BOOKS
What is your favorite genre?
I like plot twists, Hector. Sometimes, you can get one in kid books; sometimes, even in anatomy textbooks!
When the story winds around the bone, like a muscle, and the reader's thought cuts it, like a razor, and sense is pouring out of the cut throat…
What the hell are you talking about?!
Oh… Sorry, I got carried away… I should write that down…
To cut a long story short, I like different books.
DISCUSS THE WHITE-GLOVED MURDERER
Have you heard of the last crime by the white-gloved murderer?
What do they say?
Found another body. Right under the bridge. I used to cross that bridge on the bus before.
And now they find this poor woman there… Naked, destroyed. Someone's daughter, sister, mother…
Who could do that to a woman?!
Perhaps, the criminal has a goal. Maybe, he's trying to send a message to the world.
What message could that barbarism convey?
He brutally murders women, but first undresses them completely, for whatever reason, and puts white gloves on them.
The newspapers say it's his signature. Why gloves? What signature? Is he a janitor?
Why necessarily a janitor? Perhaps, he thinks he's on a great mission. Like a surgeon, removing cancer cells.
Like a director, orchestrating the symphony of other lives…
Are you trying to justify his actions?!
Not at all! Murders are so horrible. I completely agree with you.
I must go now. Got things to do.
DISCUSS NEWSPAPER CLIPPINGS
You're into criminal stats? Why?
Since when is collecting newspaper clippings illegal?
I'm a writer, I write detective stories, so this helps me to gather material.
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
Medina, could you lock your cat in the basement?
I hate animals, I must leave in a clean place. Both physically and spiritually.
And those dirty animals destroy my harmony. Sometimes I want to hurt them, but forbid myself.
No way! This is the only living being I'm really attached to.
Mind you, if something happens to Order, you'll be in major trouble!
Sorry, it's just that I avoid animals all my life.
Do you have kids, Hector?
Yes, a son, he's 30.
Too bad you don't have a younger daughter. Two kid families are perfect!
Sometimes I just don't get you, Lionel.
END CONVERSATION
Hector! Someone's been frisking my room! I'm sure it was you! You saw something very private. I won't put up with this!
I will report you!
Nobody has the right to touch my wife's remnants!
I…
I'm not inclined to listen to your excuses.
MEET
Greetings, I'm Hector Medina, the manager.
I'm Christopher Danson, Ministry of Order Field Officer.
My wife and I are supposed to be issued an apartment in section B; we will be temporarily staying at your building.
DISCUSS BLOOD DONATION
Have you heard of bloodmobiles?
You bet! Three days ago we were guarding one, three of the "outsorts" attacked poor nurse…
"Outsorts"?
People with inherited illnesses, those "genetic traitors".
So it's true… I thought it was an evil joke.
Joke! Three labor camps are already open and welcoming the "outsorts"!
Oh…
DISCUSS WAR
What's up front?
What do you mean, Hector?
War is the cauldron of violence devouring our age…
You're a poet, Christopher.
Those are the words of a pacifist we sent to jail for 20 years. He was handing out anti-war flyers.
DISCUSS BEATING HIS WIFE
I saw you beat your wife!
What do you care about my life?
MAKE DEROGATORY COMMENT
That's unacceptable!
Get out while you can!
ASK WHAT'S UP (-500 reputation points)
Christopher, you must be aware of my job responsibilities. I can't let the fact of domestic battery go unnoticed.
I'm stranded here, Hector. It's not what you think it is.
But, it's hard to explain. I beat my wife, because she wants it.
I don't understand, Christopher. Is this some sort of a joke?
No, I mean it. Her job is very emotionally demanding, and at home she… You must know, I'll never hurt her!
It's hard to believe, but I'm against violence. There's too much of it in my life.
What do you mean?
I've been a police officer for over 15 years. You should know what I mean. People are afraid of cops. My subordinates are afraid of me. I'm afraid of my boss.
My boss is afraid of his boss, his boss is afraid of the minister… And it's the same in any government body. A chain of fear and cruelty.
If only you knew, how tired I am of all this…
Honestly, I'm surprised…
My father has been beating me all my childhood. Thought that to be the best way of upbringing.
When I turned 15, I escaped into the army; dreamt of coming back and kicking his ass. But after I came back, I realized it wasn't good life that turned him into this, and that I couldn't change him.
He believes a strong one should show his strength, or get eaten.
You don't see him very often, I believe?
That's right. He moved far away recently.
He still loves a good fight, even though he's almost 90.
What? 90?!
But what about euthanasia?
Oh, I meant 70.
That's enough.
Wait, I got an invitation… I won't make it till fall. Please!
That's enough, Hector.
Hector! Do you realize the difference between us? You're a nobody, I'm a Ministry of Order Officer! Don't try to press me.
END CONVERSATION
That's none of my business, I'm sorry.
ASK ABOUT FATHER
Christopher, it's vital for me, if your father really is almost 90, I have one question. How did he avoid euthanasia?!!
I told you, you're wrong.
I can tell it's time to put you to rest. You're half-deaf!
Christopher, it's vital for me, I have proof you're covering up for your father!
How did he avoid euthanasia?!!
You have me cornered, Hector.
He is alive, indeed. But I can't tell you anything else.
CONTINUE CONVERSATION (-500 reputation points)
My wife works in the euthanasia center, and I served at the border. I've got connections.
Together, we saved all of our elderly relatives, and shipped them abroad.
ASK FOR HELP (-1000 reputation points)
Save me!
Talk to my wife. Without her, you're doomed. I can't order her, she risks more than just her job.
Hector! Do you realize the difference between us? You're a nobody, I'm a Ministry of Order Officer! Don't try to press me.
MAKE HIM HELP
You must help me, or I'll send you to jail! I've got evidence, your father's letter!
Okay, Hector. But beware, you might regret this.
When it's time for you to go to the Euthanasia Center, I'll make sure you don't make it to there.
What will you do to me?
Afraid? Too late for this, Hector. First you threaten me, now you're scared?
After you get in our car, you'll have a heart attack, and we'll take the body to the morgue. Any body. My sister works there, so it shouldn't be a problem.
What you are to do with your life after that, is none of my business.
TALK LATER
DISCUSS EUTHANASIA
You said you saved your elderly relatives.
ASK WHAT HE WANTS
What do you want?
About euthanasia… You've made a deal with Gertrude. We'll help you.
Here's the plan: you'll be taken to the Euthanasia Venter. Don't worry, the policemen will bit you up a bit to make it look believable.
Gertrude will meet you at the Center. She'll use sleeping aid instead of poison. You'll wake up on a boat.
Take money with, Hector. The more you have, the better off you'll be on the other shore.
Can I take my cat?
Your cat? Should I order a personal jet for it?
What do you think of airborne animals, Hector? I've heard the Minister of Economy has a personal plane for his dog.
I mean it! It's important for me!
Okay. Don't see why should this be a problem.
DISCUSS AGREEMENT
I'm here to discuss our agreement.
I have nothing more to say, Hector. As soon as your time is up, or you volunteer for the Blissful Sleep, my guys will take care of it.
We'll see, it might even be my shift. In any case, you won't get to the Euthanasia Center.
Will you stick to your word?
I will.
DISCUSS HARD LABOR
You said you were uncomfortable at your workplace.
My coworkers are aggressive idiots. My boss is always furious, and those doughnuts he keeps munching on have made him huge.
Are you afraid of him?
I suppose. Yes, you're right.
OFFER WAY TO COPE WITH FEAR
Christopher, you told me you had issues getting along with your boss.
I've a great potion against fear. Would you like some?
What harm could it possibly do… Hand it over.
MEET
I'm Hector Medina, the manager of the apartment block.
I'm Gertrude Danson. Pleased to meet you, Hector.
What is your occupation? That's for my report.
I'm a nurse.
So, do you work in the hospital, then?
I can't tell you, Hector. State secrecy.
DISCUSS DOMESTIC BATTERY
I saw your husband beating you.
This is none of your business, Hector, so please stay out of it. You know nothing, you won't understand, and I'm not going to tell you.
And the main thing, Hector: just forget what you saw, and never spy on state officials again.
But this is my duty.
Please, don't argue. I love my husband, he is an amazing man.
That's all you need to know about our family.
DISCUSS SAVING RELATIVES
Your husband told me about his father and your job. Please, help me.
So, you know, then? Yes, I helped my dear father-in-law to survive the Blissful Sleep.
Yes, I work at the euthanasia center, and yes, I kill our citizens every day.
This makes me feel like a murderer, Hector. The guilt is unbearable, and I'm punishing myself by asking my husband to beat me.
That's the only way I can cope.
So, can you help me? Please, I don't want to die.
Hector, but you have nothing to worry about, you don't even look 80. What are you talking about?
That damn bureaucracy!
They made a mistake, so now everyone thinks I'm 85! And I already got the order to complete all of my unfinished business and go to the Euthanasia Center!
Hm. I see. I saw people way younger than 85 there… And had to put them all down.
Please, Gertrude! I beg you. You're not a ruthless killer.
CONVINCE (-2000 reputation points)
This is a huge risk. If they find out, I'll be most likely executed for state treason.
Then again, I deserve this. I could've refused to take the job…
I'll help you, Hector. You seem to be a nice guy, you managed to stay kind with the job like yours…
Here's the plan. My husband and his squad will come for you and drag you out on the street, as a criminal. They'll hit you to make it look real.
Once you're in the center, I'll give you sleeping aid; you'll wake up a day later, and will be taken out of the country. After that, you're on your own.
I don't believe you, Hector. The Ministry of Information doesn't err.
END CONVERSATION
DISCUSS THE AGREEMENT
Your life is hard, but you're a great person, Gertrude.
You have a big heart.
Okay, okay…
We'll help you.
I'll meet you at the center, and my husband will pick you up at the morgue and ship abroad. Make sure to have money on you.
Morgue?
I'll give you a shot of sleeping aid, you'll wake up in the morgue, and my husband will get you at night.
You have to trust us, Hector.
DISCUSS WEATHER
How do you like our merciless summer?
The parental advice of "dress in layers" works in any weather!
I know, right! Ever since we're kids, we hear tons of wise advice, but don't see their value.
Too often, wisdom of our parents is understood too late…
And vice versa, we retain some of the other words, even though we would've been better off forgetting.
When I was a kid, I loved singing. But mother told me it's not respectable to be a singer.
So, I went to the med school. I love music, but don't sing anymore.
DISCUSS HEALTHCARE
I've heard they started financing healthcare more.
That's true, we finally have disposable gloves and needles. Alas, the needles become blunt too fast, and cause a lot of pain.
DISCUSS MEDICAL SYMPOSIUM
I've heard there is a conference of big shots in medicine…
Though this year, some tricksters occupied one of the sections, registered by deceit and are doing crazy things.
I laughed my head off after reading their theses.
Let me think… What do you think about the report on "Using motherland soil to treat blood diseases"?
Or this one, "Ten ways to use sagebrush for infant diseases". Then again, the official section has its awkward moments, too.
I.e., "Treating respiratory diseases with lye soap". The speaker's wife is the soap factory director, as far as I know.
That's impressive!
ASK WHAT SHE WANTS
What's up?
My husband is dead!
It's horrible, he is… squished!
Something squished my husband!
You need to lay down…
Bed bugs! There are bed bugs in our apartment!
SELL SPRAY (-250 reputation points)
I have a great spray for that! It's only $500.
Okay, I'll take it.
You should do it for free, Hector!
COMFORT
No way! That's a clean house, I exterminate in all apartments annually!
Exterminate?! Oh, you mean the bugs…
I believe you, but I also believe my eyes, and they tell me our bed is swarming with bugs!
Okay, Gertrude, I'll deal with it.
TALK ABOUT THE BEDBUGS
Can you exterminate them?
Talk to Cristofer and discuss the details.
Ministry of Information. Greetings, Hector. What is your concern?
Hello. I need to find out who someone is. How do I go about doing that?
Find an item with the person's DNA and then give to the courier.
Request accepted. The courier will arrive today.
Your citizenship level is too low. You need more reputation points.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (DISCUSS EUTHANASIA)
Have you heard of the Blissful Sleep procedure? You know I'm not 85 years old! I don't want to die!
Everybody wants to live in paradise but no one wants to die. That doesn't change anything, however.
You're mistaken about not being 85. The Ministry of Congratulations doesn't err.
If the registry says you're 85, you're 85.
But I'm not even 65! Can't anyone at the Ministry fix the paper?
You mean commit fraud? Medina, are you insane?
Anyone trying to fix this so-called "error" will be branded a federal criminal and arrested immediately!
Do you want someone to sacrifice their life to commit treason for you?
Remember, once and for all: no Ministry of our Great State ever makes a mistake!
Even thinking that way is a crime!
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (DISCUSS ZLATA'S REAL PARENTAGE)
Comrade Hempf, I have a personal request.
Hector, you do realize making personal requests to a state official is considered an abuse of authority?
There's no room for anything personal in our Great State. Everything is for the communal good.
I'm sorry. I won't trouble you again.
You give up too easily, Medina! The communal good consists of the happiness of every citizen!
And I can tell you're not after personal gain. What is it?
I need to know who Zlata Schimmer's real parents are. You see, she was adopted.
Zlata was hit by a car recently and needs a bone marrow donor.
She was adopted? Oh yes, I remember that very clearly. Ha ha ha...
So?
Information is expensive, Hector. I'll give you what you're seeking in exchange for something else.
What do you want me to do?
Not you. Maria Schimmer. I'd like her to do me a... uh... personal favor...
Arrange a rendezvous and I'll bring you the information.
What? I don't understand...
Of course you do, Medina. You're a grown man. Tell Maria I'll be waiting for her in my apartment.
If it makes her feel better, tell her I have champagne and fruit.
But comrade Hempf... That's an egregious abuse of authority!
Doesn't that go against the best interest of our citizens and state?
Oh, Hector, I do not separate myself from our Great State.
What's good for me is good for the people and vice versa. So enough chit-chat; get back to work!
But she's married! How could I even bring that up?
With your mouth, Hector. That's what people normally use to communicate.
Her child's life is at stake; she'll do anything.
And if she becomes stubborn, remind her that she got through it the last time, when she was adopting the girl.
Remind Maria that I was the one who helped them get that child!
To satisfy their selfish desire to propagate, I had to deprive another family of its happiness. My heart still bleeds when I think about that.
Goodness! You gave them someone else's child to satisfy your lust?!
I don't like your tone, Medina, or the way you're twisting the facts.
I helped a childless couple have a kid, thereby creating a functional social unit. That's a fact!
Is there any other way?
Why am I wasting my time on you, Medina? Don't answer that question; it's rhetorical.
There's another way. My nephew graduated from the cattle breeding institute recently. He needs a good job.
Klaus works at the Ministry of Finance, but they're not hiring.
So, encourage him to create a vacancy.
How could he do that?
What happened to your imagination, Hector? He could give up his job so my nephew could have it.
So, Klaus quits and passes the torch to the younger generation.
Then perhaps I could help them out...
Is that all you can offer to the Schimmers?
Well, they could give me money. We're always short on liquid funds at the Ministry.
Now stop getting on my nerves; I gave you three options!
CHOOSE THE DATE WITH MARIA
It sounds awful, but I'll try to tell Maria about your offer. After all, who am I to judge her?
That's the right attitude. I must go now; I need to rest before her visit.
CHOOSE THE JOB OPTION
I'll tell Klaus he needs to quit his job. I don't know how they'll survive without his paycheck, but I suppose they have greater concerns.
He'll easily find another job! I'll see to it; don't worry.
CHOOSE THE MONEY OPTION
I hope they can find that much money.
Worry about yourself, Hector. Counting other people's money is for ministry officials, if you know what I mean.
You haven't earned a promotion yet.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (TELL HIM MARIA AGREED)
Bruno? I told Maria about your offer, and she agreed.
Wonderful, my dear Hector. See, that wasn't hard, was it?
Tell her I'll be waiting at the same place as last time.
Comrade Hempf, what about the information I requested?
What information?
Don't play stupid! You know you promised to tell me who Zlata's real parents are!
Lower your voice! You'll get the details tomorrow.
I'm not in the mood to work today. I need to go get champagne and fruit.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (TELL HIM KLAUS AGREED)
Bruno, I told Klaus about your proposal. He agreed to quit his job.
Wonderful! My nephew will be happy, as will his parents.
I can see the Ministry giving me an Outstanding Service award!
That's enough; stop bothering me.
Lower your voice. You'll get the details tomorrow. I'm not in the mood to deal with that right now.
I have to go tell my nephew the good news and celebrate with my brother!
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (TELL HIM KLAUS WILL GET THE MONEY)
Bruno, I talked to Klaus. He can get the money.
That's great news! You've made my day! What could be better?
I don't know... The Great Leader's birthday?
Yes, of course! With that much money, we could truly celebrate in style!
When will he give me the money?
Tomorrow.
Fine! What else do you want?
Yes! The information I agreed to provide.
I must go to the bank and get a safety deposit box.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (LEARN ABOUT ZLATA'S PARENTS)
Comrade Hemph, everything has been done according to your specifications.
I'm still waiting for you to give me the information about Zlata's biological parents.
Medina, you are a pain in the...
Damn you! Zlata's biological parents are Jacob and Louisa Manishek.
What?! So Marcus is Zlata's twin brother?
Who's Marcus? Eh! Don't bother telling me. I don't care!
Have a nice day, Hector.
Call the exterminators (-500 reputation points)
Hello. I'd like to request the help of a specialist. There are bed bugs in the apartment building located on 6 Krushvice St.
Hello, Mr. Medina. The exterminators are on their way and will arrive soon.
CALL THE MINISTRY OF MAINTENANCE OF ORDER (A VERBAL REPORT ON JACOB MANISHEK)
Hello! This is...
We know who you are, Hector. What's wrong?
I believe one of my tenants is using his job to do something illegal.
Why didn't you call the police, Hector?
I have no evidence, only rumors. Can you sanction an inspection?
We can do anything we want, Hector. What's the suspect's name?
Jacob Manishek.
Your vigilance is greatly appreciated, superintendent 4598. We're sending someone to manage the situation. Our preliminary investigators will deal with Mr. Manishek.
CALL LOUISA MANISHEK AT THE HOSPITAL
Hello. May I talk with Louisa Manishek? She's a patient there.
Yes. One moment, please.
Hello? Who is this? Hector? Tell me you have good news... I beg you!
Our fate is in your hands!
I HAVE THE AMOUNT YOU NEED
I'm going to transfer the money to the hospital account, Louisa. Remain optimistic!
THERE WILL BE NO MONEY
Unfortunately, you won't like what I have to tell you. I won't be able to transfer the money.
REQUEST DNA IDENTIFICATION (-2,000 points of authority)
Hello. I need a courier service to pick up a DNA sample of a citizen.
Hello. I'm calling about your newspaper ad. Are you still casting for the part of the pirate?
Yes. You can audition any time tomorrow. We're in the Youth Theatre building. The entrance is located across from the garages.
CALL BRUNO AND OFFER HIM THE STATUE
Is this comrade Hemph? I have a gift for you: a life-size statue of the Great Leader made out of top-quality granite!
A gift? A statue of the Great Leader, you say? I do happen to have the perfect spot for it in my office. To what do I owe this honor, Hector?
Does it come with the proper documents? It's not contraband, is it?
The statue is perfectly legal, comrade Hemph, and it will come with all of the required documents. You can pick it up whenever you like!
You are a GREAT superintendent, Hector! I will certainly return your kindness someday.
I'll pick up the statue at my earlier convenience.
CALL THE EUTHANASIA CENTER
National Euthanasia Center. How may I help you?
Hello. This is Hector Medina. I have put my affairs in order and would like to undergo the Blissful Sleep procedure without having to wait.
Are you truly ready?
YES
Thank you for calling. The car is coming to bring you to the center.
NO! IT'S TOO SOON!
Keep in mind that you must arrive at the Euthanasia Center by the specified time. The car will be waiting. Good-bye.

Ministry of Information. Hello, Hector, how may we help you?
Hello, citizen whereabouts inquiry.
Name: Marcus. Last name: Manishek.
Stay on hold…
Marcus Manishek has been transferred to Orphanage No. 9
I'LL CALL BACK LATER
Louisa, I'll give you a call as soon as I have the money.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (REPORT ABOUT THE ABSENTEE BALLOT)
Comrade Hempf? I got Klaus Schimmer's ballot. How do I get it to you?
I'll come in person to send the paper to the archives.
CALL BRUNO HEMPF (TELL ABOUT MONEY)
Comrade Hempf? I have the money.

I'll be over soon.

Dear Hector Medina! Congratulations on your 85th birthday! Eighty-five is a grand age, worthy of honor and respect.
You served your Great Country well, and now it's your country's turn to serve you.

In the meantime, please put your affairs in order.

What's the Genetic Purity Program?
The Ministry of Order authorized the Genetic Purity Program a week ago.

Hector Medina? Ministry of Information Acquisition.
There is a certain Johanne Bessler in your block. Gather information and profile him.

You are to perform a background check, and estimate the loyalty index.
Will be done.
Hector Medina! There was an explosion in your house! Explain at once!
I didn't know this psycho will experiment in the apartment! Good thing I decided to not trust him with the State money!
You are to deal with the consequence!
Don't worry, I will fix everything and evict this madman.

Hello, Hector. Information according to your request No. 01272017
Name: Mary

Ministry of Information Acquisition.

APPROVE

RECEIVE A PRIVATE CALL

I am scared. I've heard that the operation is very complicated and there's only a small chance of success!
A famous surgeon, Alloizy Shpak, is here to give a lecture. If he performs the surgery, we'll survive.

Thank you!

It rained the day of Carl's funeral. When his cheap pinewood coffin was covered with soil, the bleak autumn sun peaked out from behind the blanket of gray clouds.
A thin fog was settling over the cemetery.
No one from Carl Stein's family was destined to live to the end of the year.

The entire neighborhood came to see Carl dragged into the police car. His face was covered with blood, and his pants had a hole where his building keys had been, as the police had torn them out with the fabric.
To the bitter end of his short life, Carl wondered what happened to his family.
Press any key to continue
Anna has died.
Patrick has died.
Martha has died.
Due to the efforts of hundreds and thousands people like Carl Stein, the state machine kept growing and growing. The New Tomorrow movement was destroyed, and all of its members arrested.
Some of them died in the mines; the others perished while being punished or were executed. Their weak voices were drowned by a cacophony of mottos and slogans.
Dissidence was exterminated without mercy, and the citizenry was of a single mind: no doubts, no reluctance, no unnecessary questions. Isn't that happiness?

The spark of the New Tomorrow movement gradually fanned the flames of a revolution, and the Wise Leader's tyranny was overthrown. It took years to dispose of the enormous bureaucratic machine, but in time, the people could finally sleep peacefully at night.

Freedom of Speech and the Right to Privacy were the first entitlements the new democratic government restored, and every official that misused his or her position was arrested and locked up in the jail cells previously occupied by political prisoners.
Although the revolution took many honest lives as well, one can't make an omelet without breaking a few eggs, right?
The war raged on for decades, grinding the people into a homogenous, meaty pulp.
Able-bodied youth died by the thousands every day in the pointless massacre.
And all technological, medical, and agricultural progress was sacrificed in the name of violence.
Unexpectedly, each party having an ultima ratio turned the tables. Both sides were afraid to use it.
But the fear of the enemy using the 'nuclear club' was even stronger. That lead to the cooldown of military operations; several decades later, a reluctant peace was made.
Though not at once, both countries managed the economical conversion. But the search for external enemies never seized completely...
The rumors of gas turning people into zombie patriots and of weapons of mass destruction reached the frontline. Overcome with fear, officers from both sides plotted together and started a coup.

But after they arrested the current governments and announced the end of the war, they lost control of their respective countries. Mass desertions from both armies paved the way for chaos, and marauders and bandits seized the arsenals of both nations and took control.
Unfortunately, the constantly changing leadership of both countries made it impossible to turn either economy around. Unemployment, overpopulation, and hunger are still at epidemic levels.
Carl stayed in his first story apartment. Eventually, he became rich and could buy anything he wanted. But no matter how hard Carl tried to lie to himself, the loss of his family ruined him.
He missed Anna's nagging, Patrick's juvenile maximalism, and Martha's happy laughter.
The walls of Carl's apartment caved in on him, trapping him under the monstrous weight of his memories and guilt, and he remained depressed and suicidal until the end of his days.
Carl and his wife and daughter stayed in their first story apartment, and Anna found a job.
Even though Martha's poor health remained a source of stress for her parents, they had enough to pay for her treatment, and her happy laughter often brightened their moods.
It's a shame things didn't turn out differently for Patrick, though. His family missed his juvenile maximalism and drive to succeed.
Carl and his wife stayed in their first story apartment, and Anna found a job. In time, they became rich and could buy anything they wanted.
Martha's death hit them hard, though, and Patrick's fate ruined what little was left of their former happiness.
The silently agreed to not have any more children, considering this cruel world to be an improper place for kids.
Carl and his daughter stayed in their first story apartment. Although Martha was his only joy, she helped him survive his wife's death.
She supported and loved her father, and he returned her familial affection.
But the fate of Anna and Patrick forever cast a shadow of quiet sadness over their house.
The family's attempt to emigrate failed. Carl wasn't simply arrested; he was executed on the spot as a traitor and a state criminal.
His family's fate was all over the mass media, and their deaths served as a dire warning to anyone considering escape.
At long last, the iron curtain fell.

Carl and his family made it across the border, where they found friendly smiles, clean streets, and beautiful blue skies. As soon as they stopped worrying for their lives, they realized living without constant supervision was not only possible, it was liberating!

Patrick graduated from the local college and became a successful architect, building gorgeous and comfortable houses. (He could never bring himself to design an apartment building.) Martha's health improved considerably in the warm climate, and her charming smile left no one untouched.

Eventually, the family saved up enough to open a small café, which Anna managed. Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too. He is now the best librarian in the country, and he never thinks of the broken people of Krushvice 6. Well, almost never...

Martha's health improved considerably in the warm climate, and her charming smile left no one untouched. Eventually, the family saved up enough to open a small café, which Anna managed.
Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too. He is now the best librarian in the country, and he never thinks of what happened to his son. Well, almost never...

Patrick graduated from the local college and became a successful architect, building gorgeous and comfortable houses. (He could never bring himself to design an apartment building.) Eventually, the family saved up enough to open a small café, which Anna managed.

Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too, as he is now the best librarian in the country. His work cannot keep him from seeing his daughter's smile, though, and he often goes to a secluded spot in the library where he can be alone with his broken heart and cry tears he wants no one to see...

Carl and his children made it across the border, where they found friendly smiles, clean streets, and beautiful blue skies. As soon as they stopped worrying for their lives, they realized living without constant supervision was not only possible, it was liberating!

Patrick graduated from the local college and became a successful architect, building gorgeous and comfortable houses. (He could never bring himself to design an apartment building.) Martha's health improved considerably in the warm climate, and her charming smile left no one untouched.

Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too, and he is now the best librarian in the country. However, the loss of Anna cast a shadow of sadness over their blissful new life, and Carl spent the rest of his days trying to explain to his children – and himself – why his wife wasn't there...

Carl and Martha made it across the border, where they found friendly smiles, clean streets, and beautiful blue skies. As soon as they stopped worrying for their lives, they realized living without constant supervision was not only possible, it was liberating.

Martha's health improved considerably in the warm climate, and her charming smile left no one untouched. Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too, as he is now the best librarian in the country.

However, the loss of Anna cast a shadow of sadness over their blissful new life, and Carl spent the rest of his days trying to explain to his daughter – and himself – why his wife wasn't there... And grief caused by Patrick's fate, plagues their seemingly careless life.

Carl and Patrick made it across the border, where they found friendly smiles, clean streets, and beautiful blue skies. As soon as they stopped worrying for their lives, they realized living without constant supervision was not only possible, it was liberating!

Patrick graduated from the local college and became a successful architect, building gorgeous and comfortable houses. (He could never bring himself to design an apartment building.) Carl's experience in cataloguing data and observing others came in handy, too, as he is now the best librarian in the country. However, he is also terribly unhappy.
The losses he suffered filled his life with debilitating pain, and Patrick, who blamed Carl for Anna's and Martha's deaths, never spoke to his father again.
The side effects of the experimental sleep suppressant given to Carl during the medical check-up were catastrophic, and in time, he slipped into a coma.
His slumbering mind fruitlessly tried to escape the imaginary world, where Carl was charged with a horribly dull task: searching for the center of the universe.
He found it many times, but it always contained nothing. NOTHING, CARL!

Carl and his family stayed in their first story apartment, and Anna found a job. Even though Martha's poor health remained a source of stress for her parents, they had enough to pay for her treatment, and her happy laughter often brightened their moods.
However, Patrick's unfriendly disposition eventually become unbearable, and his parents sighed with relief when he signed up for the frontline.
Relief quickly transformed into horror when he was reported missing in action. Sadly, they never found out what happened to him.

Carl and his wife and son stayed in their first story apartment, and Anna found a job. Patrick's unfriendly disposition eventually become unbearable, though, and his parents sighed with relief when he signed up for the frontline. Relief quickly transformed into horror when he was reported missing in action. Sadly, they never found out what happened to him.
Although they eventually became rich and could buy anything they wanted, Martha's death hit them hard, and Patrick's fate ruined what little was left of their former happiness.
They silently agreed to not have any more children, considering this cruel world to be an improper place for kids.

Carl and his children stayed in their first story apartment. Patrick's unfriendly disposition eventually become unbearable, though, and Carl sighed with relief when his son signed up for the frontline.

Relief quickly transformed into horror when Patrick was reported missing in action. Sadly, Carl never found out what happened to him. Although Martha was his only joy, she helped him survive his wife's death. She supported and loved her father, and he returned her familial affection.
But the fate of Anna and Patrick forever cast a shadow of quiet sadness over their house.
Carl's remarkable determination and loyalty to his job was well rewarded. The state had finally found its ideal employee: one with no doubt, remorse, or attachments!
Carl was chosen to become the Golden Standard of Citizenship in a new cloning experiment, and before long, thousands of duplicate Carls started their jobs.
The original Carl died in the process, but no one cried for him because there was no place for regret in the Wonderful Future of the Great State. Only Happiness, always Hardcore!
A massive explosion destroyed the whole apartment block. Old beams couldn't hold it, and the roof collapsed, burying every tenant in ruins.
The fire erupted and was spread all over the neighborhood by severe winds. Fire killed everyone, state criminals and honest citizens alike. In two hours, Krushvice Street was gone.
The sad fate of Carl and his family was only briefly mentioned in the newspaper obituary, which read, "Died of natural cause..."

You live in the best country in the world! And other countries are jealous of you! Each of our citizens receives all he or she needs to lead a happy and carefree life: soap, sugar, bread, and certificates of appreciation! Just remember: our foes are continually plotting against us! Thankfully, our Great Leader effortlessly disperses the waves of terror our treacherous enemies send crashing upon our Great State. Still, you must be vigilant! Keep an eye on your surroundings, watch out for agents of sabotage, and report every transgression! Do not let aggressive imperialism cast a shadow over our labor and valor! To counter the hostile attacks and defend our right to live as we wish, we will move forward along our own path, and prove that the people and the party are one! Our Great Leader is the mind, honor, and conscience of the State! May he live long and prosper!

Citizens! War is raging, and invaders have surrounded our country! Yet our Great Leader is doing nothing but searching for traitors in his attempt to cling to power! The state constantly feeds us false propaganda, claiming the Motherland is in danger, and the party-controlled mass media call for workers and farmers to find spies among their family members! It's time to say no to their ongoing oppression! Hundreds of thousands of laborers have answered our call, and are assisting the Revolution and the arrival of a New Tomorrow! Our country is falling apart, and our people are starving! Our motto is your clarion call: Muster all of your strength to fight the real enemy – the tyranny of the so-called Great Leader! Join the movement toward a New Tomorrow! Let the voice of truth be heard across the land!

Hello, little one! Today, we will tell you a wise tale of three piglets. Once upon a time, there was a huge apartment complex managed by the Grey Wolf. Three piglets, all of whom were brothers, lived there. Their names were Nih-Nih, Nah-Nah, and Nuh-Nuh. Nih-Nih was very poor: he slept on a straw mattress and used a rag nailed to the wall instead of a door. This little piglet had a dairy in which he recorded all of his troubles with the landlord. He was sure his home was his fortress, and believed nobody would ever find his book. Nah-Nah had more than his brother. He had a real bed, and his door was made of plywood and had a latch. At night, Nah-Nah liked to experiment with his radio. In time, he was able to tune into a foreign radio station prohibited by the Grey Wolf. Nuh-Nuh, the oldest, loved his life. He had a king-size bed and a sturdy oak door with a huge iron lock. He worked in the Ministry of Groceries, and lived high on the hog, selling stolen food to his brothers. Then came the day when the Grey Wolf ran out of patience. He pulled aside the little brother's rag, knocked out the middle one's plywood door, and unlocked the oldest one's oak door. Then he took the fat, lazy piglets to the factory to be turned into delicious sausages. He then gave the links to the other tenants – the very ones who had diligently watched and reported the activities of the piglets to the Grey Wolf. All this happened because the piglets forgot who gave them everything they had. So remember, little one, it doesn't matter how you live: the landlord sees it all! Just be happy you don't get sausages for dinner too often; in means we don't have many traitors among us!

The Ministry of Care announces the solution to providing decent retirement for our senior citizens! Why pay pensions to those who are not working and serving our Great Motherland? We are proud to open the innovative International Euthanasia Center! All citizens aged 85 and older are mandated to report to the center within two weeks and undergo the Blissful Sleep procedure! Be responsible, comrade! You lived your life; let others have a go at theirs!
The Ministry of Order reminds its citizens that they are required to report anyone who is dodging his or her civic duty.
Happy 85th birthday!
Ministry of Congratulations

Hector Medina's efforts to keep his building in order were not enough. As he was dragged out of his apartment, beaten and defeated, Hector realized nobody in the Ministry had ever expected him to succeed.
As soon as Hector received that damned card, they chose his successor.
Hector was consigned to spend several days in a cold prison cell, waiting to be murdered during what the Ministry was cowardly calling the Blissful Sleep procedure.
Even though Hector had given up and was ready to undergo euthanasia voluntarily, nobody appreciated his obedience. Instead, the policemen who came to fetch him beat him and threw him in the truck.
They weren't mean people; they had just forgotten things could be done differently. In the machinery of a big state, every little cog and gear is simply doing its job.

Hector's last moments were filled with pain from his bruises, the cold prick of a needle and a surge of sleepiness. He had no energy left to think of the glorious past. The only thing he remembered was that a Great State led by a Wise Leader does not err.
Money can open many doors when you're young. But the older you get, the more you realize some doors are best left unopened, and it's a good idea to always have an escape plan.
Hector had to give everything he had to the boss to avoid death.
The maddeningly monotonous work in the archive, the piles of dusty papers and an incurable invisibility became Hector's new norm. He wrote hundreds of letters to his son but never mailed any of them.
Hector Medina was dead to the outer world. As for himself, he kept wondering until he breathed his dying breath if he'd ever lived at all.
Harsh times demand harsh measures. But trying to strike a deal with his morals was a real struggle for Hector.
Infuriated by the attempt at blackmail, the policeman did what Hector had told him to do, but in his own manner. Hector survived, but was left completely broken.

Hector had no ID or other papers, and was forced to hide in the slums to avoid the government officials who were looking for him. As his stomach growled from hunger and he spent his days and nights shivering in the cold, Hector came to think the Blissful Sleep procedure wouldn't have been such a bad choice. The only thing that kept him going was his dream of seeing his son again. Too bad it never came true.
When people whose souls seem to have been crushed into oblivion turn out to be capable of compassion, the beauty of their actions is indescribable.
To thank Hector for helping their family, the policeman and his wife managed to stage Hector's death in the Euthanasia Center and ship him abroad.

Once Hector had left his chilly, humid basement behind and was soaking up warm sunlight, and feeling soft sand beneath his feet, and letting cool, refreshing seawater wash over his old bones, his rheumatism was cured.
Even though Hector had to work long after he should have retired, he never complained. He had time to write to his son, and sometimes even heard back from him.
When people whose souls seem to have been crushed into oblivion turn out to be capable of compassion, the beauty of their actions is indescribable.
To thank Hector for helping their family, the policeman and his wife managed to stage Hector's death in the Euthanasia Center and ship him abroad.

Once Hector had left his chilly, humid basement behind and was soaking up warm sunlight, and feeling soft sand beneath his feet, and letting cool seawater wash over his old bones, his rheumatism was cured. He eventually made enough money to buy every necessity. But this triumph paled in comparison to when he finally convinced his son to move in with him.
The only thing Hector tried to avoid thinking about was how many people he'd deprived of happiness, and how many lives he'd crushed on his path to prosperity.
